3949: An unemployed single mother becomes a legal assistant and almost single-handedly brings down a California power company accused of polluting a city’s water supply.

1564: The new teacher at a severely administered boys’ boarding school works to positively effect the students’ lives through music.

36082: One night, Arlequin come to see his lover Colombine. But when Pierrot knocks on the door, Colombine and Arlequin hide. Pierrot starts singing but Arlequin scares him and the poor man goes away.

70457: Two aspiring actresses — refined Lauren and brassy Sandy — seem to have nothing in common, until they learn they share the same boyfriend. When he mysteriously disappears, the ladies embark on a wacky cross-country pursuit to track him down.

32020: It’s 1912 and the patrons of ‘The Last Chance Saloon’ have gathered for their evening of whiskey to contemplate their lost faith and dreams, when Hickey (Lee Marvin) arrives.

94920: Flares of suns, imprismed midst yellows and greens and vibrant sky blues…
The Cat of the Worms Green Realm

108253: Two cars meet up along a narrow street in Palermo, and neither driver’s in the mood to make way for the other. The town starts taking bets on who’ll give in first.

266: Katsuhito Ishii, along with two of his pals, takes elements from his previous films to create an utterly surreal omnibus that ranges from the utterly bizarre to the unbelievably funny.

154258: Diah takes Jarwo in a warehouse during the lunch break . She said she needed money quickly. She offers Jarwo to buy a match for 10,000 rupiahs. With this match, he will watch Diah get stripped and may have a sex with her….

12233: Carla Moran awakens one night to find herself being beaten and raped by an unseen presence.

13069: Repelled by the commercialism he sees around him, Charlie Brown tries to find the true meaning of Christmas.

149937: As the sisters who raised him have to leave, Henry has to figure out how to live by himself within the city. He finds a job in a lighting shop and claims to «lighten up people’s life». His job will bring him to discover friendship and love.

88: A young architect from Bangkok flirts and falls in love with a young woman who runs a hotel in a tsunami-ravaged small town.

31777: Blizzard, deranged from a childhood operation in which both his legs were perhaps needlessly amputated after an accident, becomes a vicious criminal, and eventually mob leader of the San Francisco underworld.

109929: Three college friends hit the biggest party of the year, where a mysterious phenomenon disrupts the night, quickly descending into a chaos that challenges their friendships — and whether they can stay alive.

34897: Inside a Chinese prison two inmates form a friendship and face the difficulty of life on the inside.

116217: The triumph and collapse of the great Republic (of Venice): the reasons were many and complex, historical and psychological… human and all too human.

88549: The Invasion of the Thunderbolt Pagoda is a languidly opiated costume ball in which an assortment of masked and painted bohos, some sporting outsize elf ears, loll about a candlelit, Mylar-lined set, blowing soap bubbles and nibbling majoon.

30951: Onetime campus radical Nanni Moretti renounces his past to become a priest. Returning to his home village, Moretti is appalled at the lack of religious reverence amongst the townsfolk, unable even to communicate with any of his old friends, who’ve all gleefully succumbed to the Deadly Sins.

73264: Somewhere betwixt Mexico City’s booming business district and its neglected barrios, romance buds between Renata and Ulises despite the disparity in their social stratas. To discourage the passionate teens, Renata’s family moves her to Canada.

152693: Lisa, the brothel madam of the luxurious “Le Vénusia” in Geneva, and Lena, an artless prostitute as unpredictable as she is lazy, are filmed in the intimacy of a smoking room—where their relationship will combine tenderness and cruelty.

130193: Bill Murray worries no one will show up to his T.V. show due to a terrible snow-storm in New York City.

2357: Our favourite undercover detectives from the 80’s are back in this update of the TV series. This time around, drug lords and a murder case in South Florida dangerously weave into the personal lives of Sonny Crockett and Ricardo Tubbs.

1038: A summer dress moves from an original female owner to a gay boy she makes love to in the woods. A cheeky and provocative film about ambivalence and sexuality.

32864: Looking to better their lives, friends Emma and Böbe leave the Hungarian countryside behind and head for Budapest, where they land jobs as schoolteachers but soon discover that life in the city isn’t easy in the post-communist era.
Sweet Emma, Dear Böbe - Sketches, Nudes

116373: A Parisian philosophy professor transferred to a dull provincial town (Loïc Corbery) learns to cut loose and live a little after he meets a brassy blonde coiffeuse (Emilie Dequenne), in this charming romance from director Lucas Belvaux (The Trilogy).

30449: Three Italian-American brothers, living in the slums of 1940’s New York, try to help each other with one’s wrestling career using one brother’s promotional skills and another brother’s con-artist tactics to tho wart a sleazy manager.

31613: A group of children spending Christmas in a summer resort village stumble with a woman disguised as Santa Claus in a well in the woods. They discover that she is in fact a dangerous thief who is on the run with a substantial haul. Greed, fear and darker thoughts lead them to a series of dilemmas.

109431: In over twenty countries around the world, children are direct participants in war. Denied childhood and often subjected to horrific violence, an estimated 200,000 – 300,000 children are serving as soldiers for both rebel groups and government forces in current armed conflicts.

2233: A small group of French students are studying Mao, trying to find out their position in the world and how to change the world to a Maoistic community using terrorism.

30835: Maverick documentary filmmaker Kazuo Hara once again criticizes the mores and customs of Japanese society in this unsentimental portrait of adults with cerebral palsy.

3069: Man on the run from a murder charge enlists a beautiful stranger who must put herself at risk for his cause.

34623: Activists arrive in Seattle, Washington en masse to protest a meeting of the World Trade Organization. Riots and chaos ensue as demonstrators successfully stop the WTO meetings.

4008: Ozu makes the best of what appears to be an uncharacteristic potboiler assignment involving a man (Tokihiko Okada) driven to crime to help his wife and ailing daughter, chased down by a cop (Fuyuki Yamamoto who looks like a Japanese Charles Bronson) who suddenly faces a moral dilemma.

29130: In 1923, a black town in Florida was burned to the ground, and its people murdered because of a lie. Some escaped and survived because of the courage and compassion of a few extraordinary people. This film is for them.

91154: When an innocent Midsummer celebration in a remote village turns into a slaughter, Tadas unexpectedly finds himself in the middle of a rebellion, with dozens of men at his command.

96299: Jewish prisoners in Auschwitz put God on trial.

1394: An upstanding Italian household is shaken and stirred when a handsome stranger arrives at the doorstep. He seduces every family member and then disappears. Each has an epiphany of sorts, but no one knows who the mysterious man was or why he appeared.

35805: Documentary that explores Argento’s film career.
Dario Argento: An Eye for Horror

93105: On 14 January 1931, around 8 pm, an earthquake with a reported magnitude of 7.8 and lasting 3 minutes and 10 seconds hit the city of Oaxaca in Mexico. Eisenstein, who was in Mexico filming ‘Que Viva Mexico’, flew to Oaxaca shortly after to film conditions in the affected area.

88781: Young Ursula plays in a tree and ruins her fancy dress. Her elderly mother teaches her a cruel lesson about whether things can ever be mended; what Ursula learns about how to behave may not be what her mother intended.

129896: Éléonore’s father has recently died and left her is house in Brittany, in the Côtes d’Armor region. The thirty-year-old photographer has been relatively successful, but business is no longer going well. She must absolutely sell the house…

37930: The true story of Frances Farmer’s meteoric rise to fame in Hollywood and the tragic turn her life took when she was blacklisted.

29054: When Sylvester learns of the possibly dire consequences of his passion for birds, he joins Birds Anonymous to quit. Unfortunately, the outside world taxes his resolve to the limit.

14928: A prospector sells his wife and daughter to another gold miner for the rights to a gold mine. Twenty years later, the prospector is a wealthy man who owns much of the old west town named Kingdom Come. But changes are brewing and his past is coming back to haunt him.

48923: Taking his geeky prep school roommate, Jonathan Ogner, under his worldly wing, Skip Burroughs packs him off to lose his virginity in Chicago — where Jonathan unwittingly embarks on a torrid affair with Skip’s mother.

36716: As part of a top secret military mission, a helicopter pilot uses an experimental device to experience the last eight minutes of another person’s life in order to try to prevent a terrorist attack.

93061: The balance of power and desire constantly shifts during the meeting of an older journalist and a young student, of two generations completely foreign to one another.

40876: When Clark Griswold puts his mind to something, we soon realize he hasn’t got one. Still, nothing stops him when the vacation bug hits. This time, he’s chosen Las Vegas, the new family entertainment capital of America!

27096: Chen Zhen, a Chinese engineering student in Kyoto, who braves the insults and abuse of his Japanse fellow students for his local love Mitsuko Yamada, daughter of the director, returns in 1937 to his native Shanga

124623: A team of trainees of the National Guard brings supply to the New Mexico Desert for a group of soldiers and scientists that are installing a monitoring system in Sector 16. They do not find anybody in the camp, and they receive a blurred distress signal from the hills.

21101: Daniel, a fifteen-year-old boy, lives in his own small world facing his apparently insoluble issues: a girlfriend who doesn’t know what she wants, a friend who is accused of stealing, and a small town that will have to be left behind.

23150: A pilot, stranded in the desert, meets a little boy who is a prince on a planet.

41650: The daughter of a riverboat captain falls in love with a charming gambler, but their fairytale romance is threatened when his luck turns sour.

87965: Loosely based on the life of Marilyn Monroe, the story of a young woman destined from childhood on to be adored by millions but unhappy in her own life.

43765: Interviews with a procurer and with nineteen boys and young men who are prostitutes in Prague. The youths range in age from 14 to 19.

21065: Chronicling one night in the lives of young Native American men and women living in the Bunker Hill district of Los Angeles, the film follows a group of exiles—arrivals from the Southwest reservations—as they flirt, drink, party, fight, and dance.

61527: The music video to American disco group Village People’s 1978 hit song, Y.M.C.A.

23034: An adaptation of Victor Hugo’s classic.
Victor Hugo's The Hunchback of Notre-Dame

80578: When Rob, Nathan and Lube discover the sex bible left behind by their horny predecessors at East Great Falls High School, the hilarious quest for landing babes continues as the desperate virgins set out to score the big home run.
American Pie Presents: The Book of Love

46755: Mickey and his barnyard pals put on a show that includes dancing ducks, opera singing by Patricia Pig, and Mickey’s own rendition of his theme song, “Minnie’s Yoo Hoo.”

24055: Leopold, a smug, still-hunky 50-year-old businessman, picks up and seduces fresh-faced, carrot-topped 19-year-old Franz who swiftly moves into his bachelor pad. Their cozy relationship soon sours as Leopold, a kind of gone-to-seed Dirk Bogarde, turns cranky and argumentative.

20193: In China, religious positions have always been controlled very closely. In this lavishly photographed story, set in a Buddhist monastery during the Ming Dynasty (14th-17th centuries), the monastery is in turmoil, wondering who the government is going to appoint as its next abbot.

86893: Young Hansel and Gretel get lost in the forest, and stumble across a gingerbread cottage owned by an evil witch…

9009: Chantal Akerman’s big-budget burlesque comedy about the adventures of Henry (William Hurt) and Beatrice (Juliette Binoche) who swap apartments.

24131: The story of the high school students Mikako Nagamine and Noboru Terao. When the alien Tarsians attack, Mikako volunteers to be a pilot in the space force that will protect mankind.

65629: When Yang Hu Yun is ordered to protect a shipment of gold through dangerous territory, he hires a team of guards that includes an expert swordsman, a pair of axe-wielding warriors and a drunken master to fight off bandits who want the loot.
The Kid with the Golden Arm

38478: When life becomes nothing more than memories, an old solitary woman decides to continue weaving her own destiny.

39622: As the Nobel Prize winners come to Stockholm to receive their awards, their lives are overturned and perturbed in various ways.

59173: This action-packed adventure finds Lt. Curran leading a Navy SEAL unit on a mission to Beirut, Lebanon, to rescue a group of American hostages. But the SEALs face an even greater threat when they learn that the terrorists possess Stinger missiles.

26160: A once celebrated Russian conductor plans his comeback by accepting an invitation from the Théâtre du Châtelet that was addressed to someone else.

44660: Chip ‘n’ Dale’s house is being chopped down by a snowbound Donald for firewood, along with their store of nuts!

4043: Russia attacked Finland in late November 1939. This film tells the story of a Finnish platoon of reservists from the municipality of Kauhava in the province of Pohjanmaa/Osttrobottnia who leave their homes and go to war. The film focuses on the farmer brothers Martti and Paavo Hakala.

35432: Laura is a 19-year-old university freshman who desperately wants to do well in school. She works a part-time job but cannot make ends meet. One evening in which she is short of funds, she answers a personal ad online by “Joe,” 57, who seeks a female student for “tender moments.”

28321: At the behest of an old and dear friend, playwright Lillian Hellman undertakes a dangerous mission to smuggle funds into Nazi Germany.

5219: Swades is Mohan Bhargav’s Journey from a comfort lifestyle as a NASA Engineer in the U.S.A to a rural corner in his homeland en route rediscovering his roots, self-realization and fighting the demons of a developing society at the crossroads of progress.

36639: As her family falls apart, seventeen year old Sweetness O’Hara is left to fend for herself in a neighborhood where her survival is uncertain.

48470: To understand the traumatic memories stemming from an alluring patient’s past, San Francisco psychiatrist Isaac Barr enlists the aid of her married sister, Heather.

37463: A critique of the role of the male in modern Italian society and has demonstrated the possibility of a form of ‘female bonding’ between women who live, by choice, in a world without men

6012: In Havana, Cuba in the late 1950’s, a wealthy family, one of whose sons is a prominent nightclub owner, is caught in the violent transition from the oppressive regime of Batista to the Marxist government of Fidel Castro. Castro’s regime ultimately leads the nightclub owner to flee to New York.

35556: Three earthlings visit the planet Mongo to thwart the evil schemes of Emperor Ming the Merciless.

4127: Discovering covert and faulty intelligence causes a U.S. Army officer to go rogue as he hunts for Weapons of Mass Destruction in an unstable region.

55207: Michael Douglas stars as a renowned New York City shrink who must extract the whereabouts of some hidden bank loot from the mind of a violent and catatonic mental patient. If he doesn’t get it by five o’clock, his kidnapped daughter is history.

48514: In an experience more frightening than their worst nightmares, three friends tour a funeral home with a creepy mortician in this Spike Lee-produced horror anthology. Along the way, they hear a story about each of the corpses.

53390: Brash comedian Biff Brannigan constantly hits on lead stripper Dixie Daisy, who continually rejects his brazen advances. She’s more concerned with her potential stardom. Based on a story by Gypsy Rose Lee.

1117: Because of an accident, Michele, an important figure of Italian Communist Party, has lost his memory. During a long and bizarre water-polo match, strange characters urge him to remember his past.

93386: A team of scientists led by Hashimoto has managed to capture the energy of a ghost child, thanks to their newly invented device called Menger Sponge.

95211: After trying everything to get his wife Audrey (Olivia Munn) pregnant, Tommy Macklin (Paul Schneider) realizes to his horror that he may be “shooting blanks.” Terrified that his marriage may fall apart, Tommy recruits his friends (and an Indian ex-mobster) to rob a sperm bank…

89758: Two American mercenaries and a missionary couple arrive in a remote outpost, the Amazonian backwater town Mae de Deus. The local comandante tries to coerce the mercenaries into bombing the local tribe of Niaruna Indians so that their land can be annexed for gold mining.
At Play in the Fields of the Lord

15895: After much hard work, a pathologist discovers and captures a creature that lives in every vertebrate and grows when fear grips its host. “Scream for your lives!”

771: Two sisters live with their father. The younger sister is embroiled in an affair and becomes pregnant. The elder sister has run away from her husband and returned with her child to her parent’s home. Both sisters are astonished when their mother, long thought dead, turns up alive.

97240: Caught up in the machine of communism, philosopher Victor Petrini is the victim of an adverse fate.

153482: After 15 years of living together, Marie and Boris decide to get a divorce. Marie had bought the house in which they live with their two daughters, but it was Boris who had completely renovated it.

32537: Just after her engagement with Vittorio, Nelly runs away from him. As he pursued her, she looks for help to Martin, a French middle-aged man she met by accident. He helps her to escape and drives her to the airport and gives her a plane ticket to Paris.

3146: Saxophone player Charlie Parker comes to New York in 1940. He is quickly noticed for his remarkable way of playing. He becomes a drug addict but his loving wife Chan tries to help him.

31658: In a small American town, a diabolical circus and its demonic proprietor prey on the townsfolk.

95375: Koldo and Clara’s wedding is horrifically interrupted when some of the guests start showing signs of a strange illness. Before they know what’s happening, the bride and groom find themselves in the middle of a hellish ordeal, as an uncontrollable torrent of violence is unleashed.

30402: A psychodrama following an ex-student reunion; the ‘happening’, as Skolimowski calls it, is staged in a railway cattle truck by four ex-students, now doctors in the grip of middle-aged conformity, with Skolimowski (as Andrzej) acting as a kind of master of ceremonies.

3022: Boy A director John Crowley followed up that award-winning film festival favorite with this eerie yet eloquent drama concerning a young boy fascinated by death due to the fact that he lives in the hospice home for the elderly that’s owned by his parents.

38557: A compact, full-color cut-out animation as ephemeral as the colors swimming on the surface of a soap bubble.

47544: A phantom ride taken from the buffers of an engine on the L & SW railway; crossing a viaduct in Barnstaple, through Barnstaple station, past a signal box.
View from an Engine Front: Barnstaple

45969: Teenagers working at fast food called Good Burger face stiff competition from mega chain Mondo Burger who have their own fast food across the street. Ed has a homemade special sauce that makes Good Burger an instant hit..

101953: Bugs’ home in a hollow tree is marred when the magician, Ala Bahma, plasters his show posters all over it. Bugs goes to the show to heckle.

103902: A love triangle develops between the old-fashioned Christopher Tietjens, his vindictive wife Sylvia and young suffragette Valentine Wannop, within the midst of World War I and a Europe on the brink of profound change. As the war drags on, Christopher goes to fight in France, and leaves behind Sylvia

105895: A short experimental animation by Keiichi Tanaami.

21382: Although the sailor Querelle (Brad Davis) is strong, he is also an outcast. The crimes he commits free him, and this freedom gives him power. The sailors on the naval destroyer submit themselves to Querelle’s gradual transformation and give in to his will.

39669: The “real” story of Cinderella. A refreshing new take on the classic fairy tale.

25320: Jesus Franco’s campy women’s prison film: three women (Maria Rohm, Elisa Montes, Luciana Paluzzi) are sentenced to an island prison off the Panamanian coast, only to encounter torture and lesbianism.

45471: A summertime daytrip along the railway line Rome-Orvieto on a special-fare train, a group of diverse and lively characters.  Their stories merge and intersect in the beautiful scenery of a Medieval small town in central Italy.

27371: Surreal cutout (kiri-gami) animation following a young girl’s spiritual journey to an anonymous Western city, a bizarre dreamscape cluttered with elements from works by Salvador Dali, René Magritte, Giorgio de Chirico and MC Escher.

26287: A college co-ed is brutally raped and struggles alone to rebuild her life.

20310: This moody, contemplative, superbly acted drama explores the unusual and unusually intimate relationship between a magnetic and alcoholic aunt (Béatrice Dalle) and her 17-year-old nephew (Isaïe Sultan) who is coming to terms with his sexuality.

40441: Strange short film by Ruiz about a mysterious film society and a secret film.

22341: Stark naked man comes out from the sea and begins to walk the streets, interfering in daily episodes, always in search of justice.

101683: Charles is a successful graphic designer whose fame, money, and charm have provided him with a seemingly perfect life. When Ivana, the woman of his dreams, leaves him, Charles falls apart.
A Glimpse Inside the Mind of Charles Swan III

20274: Juan sings in a rock band, but he doesn’t talk much. He also works at a bakery during the night and sleeps most of the day. This is the story of one of his days and what happens when he wakes up. Hiroshima is a silent musical, based on real facts.

40525: This is a beautiful and moving portrayal of a father and son coming to grips with external hardships and their own human frailties as they attempt to earn enough money to send the boy to school.

18894: Four frames of simultaneous action that alternately follow a smitten lesbian lover as she obsesses over her partner’s dalliances and the tense goings-on of a Hollywood film production company

39680: Retiring CIA agent Nathan Muir recalls his training of Tom Bishop while working against agency politics to free him from his Chinese captors.

40704: Something has gone terribly wrong at a research station on Mars. It’s a level 5 quarantine and the only humans allowed in or out of the area are the Rapid Response Tactical Squad – hardened Space Marines armed to the teeth with enough firepower to destroy a legion of nightmarish creatures.

24193: Two young women enjoy themselves playing games in love and with their fate. Their aim: to conquer men—until the day breaks when their limited experience turns against them.

125777: The life & secrets of a “Latin Lover” told by his 5 daughters (had with 5 different women) – rivalry and memoirs are the main ingredients. The story is a mosaic of memories made by the Latin Lover’s daughters who tell about the controversial and mysterious figure of their father.

126418: The film is structured in three chronological sub-plots set in 1991, 2001 and 2011. The first story shows a young couple leaving their village during the war, the second is a love story set in a village, while the third is the coming-of-age story of a young man in his village.

103597: A teenage girl (Adèle Exarchopoulos) encounters a woman (Léa Seydoux). with blue hair and decides to transform herself into her, causing problems with the girl’s family and friends.

107451: Mariana believes in the mysterious legend of the lovers Halimah and Sukab in the island of Sawai a hundread years ago. She journeys to Sawai to feel what Halimah once felt, hoping to find Sukab there.
Someone's Wife in the Boat of Someone's Husband

39834: A group of kings become distraught when their plan to give up women for three years is spoiled by the intordution of a beautiful new princess and her friends.

45650: Micheal, a former test subject of a project to create super soldiers, is forced to escape with his comrades after the project was canceled.

25101: Rodrigo Cataño rules his household following European-style manners. All will be disrupted by the visit of an enthusiastic salesman for the Bright O’Home company. Soon-to-be 15-year-old Maru will not be able to forget the handsome salesman, but her parents have other plans for her.

47601: If BURN•E (a welding robot) had known how much trouble he’d be caused by WALL•E’s pursuit of EVE, then he’d have taken the day off.

100554: Mei, a young girl whose memory holds a priceless numerical code, finds herself pursued by the Triads, the Russian mob, and corrupt NYC cops. Coming to her aid is an ex-cage fighter whose life was destroyed by the gangsters on Mei’s trail.

104492: A vigilante cop and a vengeful father capture and interrogate an accused serial killer. What would you do if someone hurt the one you loved most? A revenge thriller with teeth, Big Bad Wolves delivers on its raw tension with operatic drama.

25065: Milosh, a retired porn star, leads a normal family life with his wife Maria and six-year old son Petar in tumultuous Serbia, trying to make ends meet. A sudden call from his former colleague Layla will change everything.

38776: Three fun-loving, morally upright brothers from Pimento University save their fiancée from their fiendish archenemy, Dan Backslide, in this spoof of the Rover Boys.
The Dover Boys at Pimento University or The Rivals of Roquefort Hall

2059: Pierre, a professional dancer, suffers from a serious heart disease. While he is waiting for a transplant which may (or may not) save his life, he has nothing better to do than look at the people around him, from the balcony of his Paris apartment.

10430: In Manhattan, the British limousine driver Alfie is surrounded by beautiful women, most of them clients, and he lives as a Don Juan, having one night stands with all of them and without any sort of commitment.

434: A romance between a soldier and country boy is ruptured by the boy’s sudden disappearance. Their story turns into a mythical venture based on Thai folklore.

32672: Music video for Nine Inch Nails song “Closer” by Mark Romanek.

114148: An Alaska State Trooper partners with a young woman who escaped the clutches of serial killer Robert Hansen to bring the murderer to justice. Based on actual events.

37992: John, an ambitious young copper, is sent undercover into the hardcore football gangs to track down the ‘generals’ – the shadowy figures who orchestrate the violence.

1252: A comical self-study of a filmmaker’s life and work spurred on by contemplation over a love letter from his wife. His dreams and anxieties are seen through his own eyes while on a long and emotional road trip to his native village.

135101: An artist struggles to finish his work. A storyline about a cult plays in his head: Fundamentalism will destroy the world. The artist’s muse is endangered by his process. Will he redeem her, in the end?

30623: One of a series of French-Canadian folk songs, this film was illustrated by Norman McLaren for the Chants populaires series. White gouache drawings on black cards were photographed with overlapping “zooms” to suggest the forward movement of a canoe along rivers and lakes.

12461: 1963, the night before 18 year-old “Birdlace” Eddie and his friends are shipped to Vietnam. They play a dirty game called ‘Dogfight’: all of them seek a woman for a party, and whoever finds the most ugly one, wins a prize…

33854: Maggie is an alluring free spirit who won’t let anyone – or anything – tie her down. But she meets her match in Jamie, whose relentless and nearly infallible charm serve him well with the ladies and in the cutthroat world of pharmaceutical sales.

31479: A group of veterans recount a horrifying experience of being trapped in a minefield, resulting in each losing their sight.

848: After an ivory-hunting safari offends an African tribe, the colonialists are captured and hideously tortured. Only Cornel Wilde’s marksman is released, without clothes or weapons, to be hunted for sport. This stripped-to-the-bone narrative is a meditation on the notion of civilization.

108565: Twenty years after the Romanian Revolution, Tavi Ionescu, a nice but somewhat immature man in his late thirties, finds out from his Securitate (Romanian Secret Police) file that he might be the father of a son he never knew about.

3367: A paroled convict teams up with his brother to reform their old R&B band in order to raise money to save the orphanage they were brought up in, encountering a number of crazy obstacles on the way.

550: Stuart Cooper’s immersive account of one twenty-year-old’s journey from basic training to the front lines of D-Day seamlessly interweaves archival war footage and a fictional narrative.

31961: The daily routine of cocaine dealer Priest who wants to score one more super deal and retire.

34681: The infamous Jack the Ripper case set in London of 1888. The Ripper has been running amok in the Whitechapel district murdering and dissecting prostitutes.

33930: In a rough style, by way of unique footage, the brutal consequences of modern wars are exposed.  The film also depicts the ability of women and children to handle their everyday life after a dramatic war experience.

152885: Based on real characters and events, this 3-episode drama tells the story of a group of Czech citizens, living under Soviet control, whose lives are sent spinning by a shocking act of protest. Episodes 1 & 2 are presented in a single program.

1336: In a desolate corner of the world, an elderly woman has come to her beloved grandson, a young officer stationed at a remote military outpost, with the enemy just beyond…

15564: A brilliant 18th century London surgeon, Daniell can only make his humanitarian medical advances by experimenting on cadavers.

4306: Satyajit Ray’s drama about the Bengal famine of 1942-1943 stars frequent Ray collaborator Soumitra Chatterjee as Gangacharan, a Brahmin who sets up a school in a remote Bengali village.

30897: The unburied dead return to life and seek human victims.

35777: Ireland will never be the same after Rawhead Rex, a particularly nasty demon, is released from his underground prison by an unwitting farmer.

28064: This is a debut feature by director Hur Jin-ho and stars two of the most popular actors in Korea today, Han Suk-kyu and Shim Eun-ha.

17535: When a corrupt American businessman tries to strong arm his way into businesses in Newcastle, England, he is thwarted by an club attendant and his waitress girlfriend.

2291: Iraqi insurgents bomb a convoy of US Marines, resulting in the death of their most popular officer. Enraged by this loss, his young Marines carry out a brutal retaliation…

90000: Trance dance and water implosion, a line drawn between secular freak-outs and religious phenomena. Shot in a single-take at a sacred site on the Upper Suriname River, the minor secrets of an animist are revealed as time itself is undone.

109493: Aningaaq, an Inuit fisherman camping on the ice over a frozen fjord, talks through a two way radio with a dying astronaut who is stranded in space, 500 kilometers above earth.

6233: A mysterious serial killer is hunting other serial killers – and one FBI agent suspects there may be more to the vigilante than they imagine.

13597: A young man reluctantly joins a traveling “family” of evil vampires, when the girl he’d tried to seduce is part of that group.

111178: The music video for “Disturbia” begins in a surrealistic torture chamber where Rihanna is seen dressed in black, wearing dark make-up and having long black nails while she presses the keys of a big dark piano and looks into the camera.

34835: In a miserable neighbourhood of Napoli, two brothers make totally different choices for their lives. The boy joins the Communist Party, while his sister follows the way of the church.

36418: Ippolita is a paralyzed young woman with serious mental problems stemming from the death of her mother…

33784: This two-part drama examines the fate of Haneke’s own generation which came of age after World War II. The first part depicts the generational gap between 1950s teenagers and their parents while the second shows this same group of characters twenty years later.

51084: College buddies chip in and promise that the group’s last unmarried man will collect a cash pot. Seven years later, the kitty is worth $500,000 — money Michael needs to pay a gambling debt.

798: Alfonso Cuarón made his mark on Mexican cinema with the  lightning-quick _Sólo con tu pareja. _Don Juan-ish yuppie Tomás Tomás spends his nights juggling so many beautiful women that he can’t keep their names straight—until a spurned nurse gives him a taste of his own medicine.

17451: Genoan navigator Christopher Columbus has a dream to find an alternative route to sail to the Indies, by traveling west instead of east, across the unchartered Ocean sea.

75351: After enduring abuse from cocky frat boys and their snotty girlfriends, freshmen nerds Lewis and Gilbert start a fraternity of brainy and socially inept cohorts in order to wreak revenge.

36864: An already ‘out’ and eccentric teenager recruits a bizarre circle of friends made up of two oddball outcasts, a straight jock he’s crushing on and a drag queen, to help him bring down the homophobic bully threatening his would-be peaceful, high-school existence.

49877: Jackie Chan stars in this parody of American Westerns as Chon Wang, a clumsy imperial guard who trails Princess Pei Pei when she is kidnapped from the Forbidden City and transported to America.

26341: Three episodes set in a small town of Veneto spring from the love affairs of a bourgeois gang. Winner of the top prize at the 1966 Cannes Film Festival.
The Birds, the Bees and the Italians

102856: A seemingly wholesome and benevolent family, the Parkers have always kept to themselves, and for good reason. Behind closed doors, patriarch Frank rules the roost with a rigorous fervor, determined to keep his ancestral customs intact at any cost…

120668: Larry (Jason Schwartzman) is an unqualified, unemployable, inebriated prankster who rides a tide of booze onto the glorious shores of an undiscriminating Quick-Lube.

22287: Shot in 1952, this is an “amateur film” done in 16mm, a sort of home movie in which Cocteau takes the viewer on a tour of a friend’s villa on the French coast.

38659: In 1965 I worked as Joseph Cornell’s assistant on boxes and films. I filmed his work extensively, and as much as I could of him. (It is the only film footage that exists of Cornell.)

102932: Far from the gay centers of the world, director Yen Tan explores the complex and oft-forgotten lives of gay men in small-town America.

46908: When scientists use eco-terrorism to impose their will on the world by affecting extremes in the weather, Intelligence Chief Cramden calls in top agent Derek Flint.

26225: Adam, sixty something, a former swimming champion, is pool attendant at a smart N’Djamena hotel. When the hotel gets taken over by new Chinese owners, he is forced to give up his job to his son Abdel. Terribly resentful, he feels socially humiliated.

87494: Warriors of the Rainbow: Seediq Bale

44959: Takayuki Yamada rises to the challenge to play all the male protagonists in this four-story film about obsessive love that will confuse and delight you.

23215: A Frenchman traveling in Istanbul meets a beautiful, secretive, exotic woman who may or may not be involved in a criminal conspiracy. He is entranced, but she remains, maddeningly, just outside his reach as he pursues her…

38491: A fictional account of the real life, eleven day, never explained 1926 disappearance of famed murder mystery writer Agatha Christie is presented. On a cold winter day, her damaged car with her expensive fur coat is found abandoned at the side of a country road.

126537: One of Björk’s most controversial music video because of its explicit sexual content and images of large needles sewing pearls to the skin. The video is about a woman preparing herself for marriage and for her lover. The second half features Björk clad in an Alexander McQueen’s dress.

25382: A socially inept fourteen year old experiences heartbreak for the first time.

18682: Scientists create a resonator to stimulate the pineal gland (sixth sense), and open up a door to a parallel (and hostile) universe. Based on a story by H. P. Lovecraft.

41969: An obscure Italian magistrate suspects that a well-known industrialist commited murder, and decides to investigate him, and bring him to court, whatever it takes. But – will the magistrate have it in him to go against impossible odds, in the name of the Italian people he represents?
In the Name of the Italian People

44689: Matt (Terence Hill) and Wilber (Bud Spencer) decide to try their hand at crime and attempt to rob a supermarket. To their chagrin, however, they stumble onto a police recruiting campaign. They stoically endure being on the right side of the law, finally becoming heroes during a drug bust.

43544: Ronald Miller is tired of being a nerd, and makes a deal with one of the most popular girls in school to help him break into the “cool” clic. He offers her a thousand dollars to pretend to be his girlfriend for a month.

23371: Traditional old Greek music rembetiko translated as a short essay to an Athenian neighborhood.

125658: A satire on anti-communist paranoia in the days of fascist dictatorship in Portugal. The film follows the adventures of the “Lusitanian superhero”, the ultra-patriotic Captain Falcon, a man who follows the direct orders of António de Oliveira Salazar in the fight against the “red menace”.

135382: A mild-mannered radio executive strives to become the best stepdad to his wife’s two children, but complications ensue when their freewheeling and freeloading real father arrives, forcing him to compete for the affection of the kids.

111057: The music video features all four performers in lingerie, also rapper Missy Elliott makes a couple of small cameos in the video and built to resemble the actual Moulin Rouge night club around the turn of the century (1890–1910).

15953: Robert DeNiro stars as a Washington spinmaster who needs a war to distract public’s attention from a sex scandal involving the President. Dustin Hoffman received an Academy Award nomination for his role in this biting political satire.

29275: In the third film of the Lone Wolf and Cub series, Ogami Itto volunteers to be tortured by Yakuza to save a prostitute, and is hired by their leader to kill an evil chamberlain.
Lone Wolf and Cub: Baby Cart to Hades

93324: Mr. Snavely, a Yukon prospector, lost his only son years ago to the temptations of the big city; now the prodigal Chester, released from prison, comes home to Ma and Pa. A parody of Yukon melodrama; includes the famous looking-out-the-door routine.

76111: When Robert “Fish” Fishman, a washed-up drummer from a 1980s supergroup, reluctantly accepts a gig on the skins in his nephew’s high school band, he discovers that his dreams of rock ‘n’ roll stardom haven’t completely died.

91375: Exuberant rhythms are created for the eyes in this nostalgic study of the single film frame, through cutting, pasting, and painting clear and photographed film images. Fleeting shapes in lush, spattered color flicker and dance to big band beats.

29311: The up-and-down and then up-again story of musician Dewey Cox, whose songs would change a nation. On his rock ‘n roll spiral, Dewey grows into a rock ’n’ roll icon and eventually earns the love of a good woman, his longtime backup singer Darlene.
Walk Hard: The Dewey Cox Story

131320: Julie Delpy writes, directs and stars in this satirical comedy about fortysomething workaholic Violette, who finds romance while on a spa vacation — but whose new beau soon has doubts when he discovers Violette’s unusual relationship with her 20-year-old son.

4185: The true story of Ron Kovic, a patriotic, All-American small town athlete who shocks his family by enlisting with the Marines to fight in the Vietnam War.
Born on the Fourth of July

3248: An ex-gun moll and showgirl is suddenly forced to protect a child whose parents have been rubbed out by the mob.

2012: An ultraconservative security guard suffers a debilitating stroke and is assigned to a rehabilitative program that includes singing lessons — with the drag queen next door.

90283: A moody and atmospheric portrait of a young woman unable to make the crucial decisions needed to move forward with her life, A Girl in Summer is also a fascinating portrait of post-Salazar youth culture.

803: In this interstellar cautionary tale, brash U.S. Navy test pilot Dan Prescott, hungry for fame, rockets himself beyond Earth’s atmosphere, only to become encrusted with cosmic dust and return a blood-drinking monster.

35988: Animation, also of a new order in the recent series of short works. Mostly on black space, the figures in blue perform a very compact and jewel-like opera in surreal form, again to Satie’s piano music.

132287: A couple expecting their first child discover an an unnerving difference between themselves and the couple living in the flat below them who are also having a baby.

94345: A small village off the mainland is about to receive a huge winter storm. It won’t be just another storm for them. A strange visitor named Andre Linoge comes to the small village and gives the residents havoc.

93088: The video sees the band in various Paris locations, hotel rooms and in a studio posing in front of a rolling backdrop. At 0:24 video shows image of Senate House of University of London with the words “Strange Love” projected on it.

28383: When a liquor store owner finds a case of “Viper” in his cellar, he decides to sell it to the local hobos at one dollar a bottle.

2176: A wacky inventor and his wife invite two other couples for a weekend party at a romantic summer house in the 1900s countryside.

114067: A widowed single mother, raising her violent son alone, finds new hope when a mysterious neighbor inserts herself into their household.

15683: The tuff biker Harley and his no less tuff Cowboy friend Marlboro learn that an old friend of them will lose his bar.
Harley Davidson and the Marlboro Man

967: The independent, unsentimental Omocha and her sister, the more tradition-minded Umekichi, are both geishas in the working-class district of Gion. Mizoguchi’s film is an uncompromising look at the forces that keep many women at the bottom rung of the social ladder.

31556: Mickey takes Minnie to a Vaudeville show after they meet in a park near a water fountain.

30250: Issiz Adam’ emphasises the desolation and seclusion of modern life and its consequences on the romantic relationship between Turkish twenty-somethings Alper and Ada.

3670: Jason Bourne evades capture by those hunting him, the CIA. Undeterred by the new generation of highly-trained killers after him, he continues his long-standing quest to uncover the origins of his dark past.

11219: A man conjures up a gigantic vengeance demon called Pumpkinhead to destroy the teenagers who accidentally killed his son.

29485: Johnny Knoxville and his buddies are up to their daredevil comic antics again. And this time they’re coming at ya’ in 3D.

32201: Among Les Blank’s masterworks, this celebration of the spirit and social traditions of New Orleans – featuring Mardi Gras and St. Patrick’s Day celebrations – is an intense insider’s portrait of the city’s street celebrations and unique cultural gumbo of the Jazz Fest and Second-line parades.

12176: This horror tale relates the consequences of a Japanese legend which tells of a man who has to betray his wife in order to achieve power.

2932: Armand Lacourtade, a 43-year-old farm equipment salesman, can no longer bear his homosexual bachelorhood. When he meets Curly, a plucky teenage girl, he changes orientations.

1745: For the past seven years Sun-woo, an impeccably dressed gangster henchman has served his boss with unflinching exactitude. However his boss’ latest request calls into question Sun-woo’s loyalty.

6488: The dramatic story of the end of WWII and the destruction faced by the Japanese people. This is the story of August 15, 1945, Japan’s longest day, where in a single 24-hour period, the fate of 100 million people would be decided.

30334: Gilgamesh prowls his box-like kingdom, setting a series of vicious traps to catch Enkidu, the guileless forest creature.

3714: A teenager journeys through a series of foster homes after her mother goes to prison for committing a crime of passion.

96648: Hapless Henry Palfrey is patronised by his self-important chief clerk at work, ignored by restaurant waiters, conned by shady second-hand car salesmen, and, worst of all, endlessly wrong-footed by unspeakably rotten cad Raymond Delauney.

10127: Jewish brothers in Nazi-occupied Eastern Europe escape into the Belarussian forests, where they join Russian resistance fighters and endeavor to build a village in order to protect themselves and about 1,000 Jewish non-combatants.

123: Set in Mexico City, a fatalistic car crash in the city sets off a chain of events in the lives of three individuals: a supermodel, a young man wanting to run off with his sister-in-law, and a homeless man who cares for stray dogs.

1895: A phobic con artist and his protege are on the verge of pulling off a lucrative swindle when the con artist’s teenage daughter arrives unexpectedly.

4775: A “lone wolf” U.S. government secret agent, Scott (Kilmer), is assigned the task of rescuing the kidnapped daughter of a high ranking government figure, only to discover along the way a larger, more sinister plot.

90473: A man finds a letter behind a painting of George Washington that is supposedly written by George Washington. The painting was at the estate of his late Grandmother. The letter discusses eating children and using their bones to make tools for eating, and is later judged authentic by an expert.

77617: When awkward Clifford arrives for a date with beautiful Kelly, he finds he’s been stood up. But her roommates, Margo and Cece, convince him to drive them around to their favorite clubs.

5953: Winsor Z. McCay bets another cartoonist that he can animate a dinosaur. So he draws a big friendly herbivore called Gertie. Then he get into his own picture. Gertie walks through the picture, eats a tree, meets her creator, and takes him carefully on her back for a ride.

37355: The film begins in 1917 with Stan (Stan Laurel) and Ollie (Oliver Hardy) being drafted into the U.S. Army to fight in World War I. While in the Army, the pair befriend a man named Eddie Smith, who is kidnapped and killed by the enemy during a battle.

28573: A friendly St. Bernard named “Cujo” contracts rabies and conducts a reign of terror on a small American town.

4611: Jiang Wen and writer Wang Shuo collaborated on this 1994 feature about coming-of-age in 1970s Beijing.
In the Heat of the Sun

35260: Frank Morris is a cunning bank robber who masterminded the elaborately detailed and, as far as anyone knows, ultimately successful escape from the infamous maximum security prison at Alcatraz.

107146: As a young boy, Ped was a geeky kid who held a crush on classmate Ern. When Ern moved away with her family to Bangkok, Ped was crushed. Now in high school, Ped and Ern are reunited after she backs to her hometown and attends the same school.

20426: Jimmy Porter, a disillusioned, angry university graduate has a wife from an upper-middle class background, Alison, and runs a sweet stall. He mistreats Alison and she leaves. Jimmy will have to come to terms with his grudge against middle-class life and values…

8682: Self-centred Roxie Hart is adored by her husband. She’s having an affair with one of his customers, Casely, who, tired of Roxie’s wily ways, attempts to leave her, triggering a stream of events that lead to Roxie’s notoriety.

40377: The sailor of legend is framed by the goddess Eris for the theft of the Book of Peace, and must travel to her realm at the end of the world to retrieve it and save the life of his childhood friend Prince Proteus.
Sinbad: Legend of the Seven Seas

22477: Presented as loosely autobiographical, Hold Me While I’m Naked centres on the tribulations of an independent filmmaker, frustrated at every turn as he tries to make a film that pretends to artistic merit.

87300: At the very moment, the precise instant that we fall in love, a particular music starts playing within us. It is different for each of us and it can occur when least expected.

21718: Chris Marker’s remarkable documentary about the rise and fall of the New Left in the 1960s and 1970s was originally released in 1977, but was reworked in 1993 in the wake of the Cold War’s end and the collapse of the Soviet Union.

107022: A very in-depth documentary that follows the very over-worked director Paul Thomas Anderson through a gruelling 80+ days of shooting for the film Magnolia (1999).

23749: An insignificant bank clerk is about to spend New Year’s Day alone when he suddenly realizes with terror his ressemblance to a notorious criminal whom the newspapers call the “Ogre of Athens”.

24484: The film deals with the plight of a North Indian Muslim family, in post-partition India in 1947. As the protagonist deals with his dilemma of whether to move to Pakistan or stay behind, the film details the slow disintegration of his family and the plight of Muslims post-partition.

118760: When a London-based conservationist is sent to Ireland to survey an area of ancient forest believed by the superstitious locals to be hallowed ground, he unwittingly disturbs a horde of terrifying beings and must fight to protect his family.

22513: 30-something Mikey comes to New York on a business trip and stays in his parents’ downtown loft. When his consulting job is finished, instead of returning home to his wife and newborn, Mikey finds an excuse to stay on. And on.

24728: Depicts a pair of travellers setting off from Paris and travelling to the Villa Noailles in Hyères. At 27 minutes the film was the longest that Man Ray directed during his career.
The Mysteries of the Chateau of Dice

103248: A young widower lives in the desert on a nuclear testing site as a hermit. He rescues a Hollywood jet-set couple in the Arizona desert when their car breaks down and holds them prisoners, as he desires the woman and wants to create a better world with her.

19228: Rosanna Arquette talks to various actresses about the pressures they face as women working in the entertainment industry.

26779: The venerable Faust story gets a contemporary treatment in this variation. This is the first motion picture directed and produced by members of La Fura Dels Baus.

23899: People with a passion for horses are observed in this Russian film by filmmaker Kira Muratova. The film has no real plot. Instead it zeros in on several scenes in which people talk about or hang out around horses.

25416: Sightseeing and documentary-filmmaking along the Riviera—the exotic colors of tourism, of Carnival and Eden. An island.  Some beach umbrellas close at the end on a happy song by Georges Delerue.

47316: This anime classic tells the story of Horus, a young Scandanavian hero entrusted with the magic Sword of the Sun. As the boy’s father lays dying, he sends Horus to his family’s ancestral home, which is under siege by the evil ice demon Grunwald.

27447: In an atmosphere of political tension when the French still control Algiers, an Algerian is killed on the beach and a French man who has lived in Algiers all his life is arrested for the murder.

91662: Upon discovering that her father had a mistress, cellist Marianne ditches her lover Etienne, and heads off in search of her.

29606: When a woman’s twin sister is drowned, she assumes her identity in order to be close to the man she feels her sister took from her years before.

32082: Cut-outs of war machines and the figure of Napoleon – contributors to an anti-war theme – encounter abstract shapes, line drawings, old-master landscapes, short bursts of ‘real-time’ landscapes and shakily photographed gestural watercolors. … ‘a synthesis of all previous techniques.’

31289: A teenager’s week in the adult psych ward brings new meaning to ‘coming of age.’
It's Kind of a Funny Story

28820: China walks down the steps towards Martim Moniz Square in Lisbon, Portugal. As she passes by, children cry out: “China, China!”. China will fly. Fly away by dawn. All she wants is to be happy. But China drinks her own poison. She drinks it to the last drop.

7535: A young businessman goes to a magic expert to learn hardness and skill with his cynical and greedy collaborators.

3597: Two college friends get together and reminisce on the woman they both fell in love with at different times in their past, and are thus propelled to find her.
Woman Is the Future of Man

29762: Two adventurers and best friends, Roland and Manu, are the victims of a practical joke that costs Manu his pilot’s license. With seeming contrition, the jokesters tell Roland and Manu about a crashed plane lying on the ocean floor off the coast of Congo stuffed with riches.

108395: Duke is a dishonest, music-loving cop who patrols the streets of Los Angeles. While taking a pee break, he meets David Dolores Frank, an adolescent who is mad about techno. Disgusted by the young man’s taste in music, Duke decides to show him what good music is.

34071: Story of international intrigue involving a university professor, an Arab prime minister, a ruthless businessman, a beautiful spy, and hieroglyphics.

15038: Two wagon caravans converge at what is now Kansas City, and combine for the westward push to Oregon. On their quest the pilgrims will experience desert heat, mountain snow, hunger, and indian attack.

48269: Set in Paris during World War I. Lili Smith/Schmidt is a German spy being requested to go under cover to help Germany during the war, to try and find out their plans.

97941: In director Charles Burnett’s first student film, eccentric and endearing young people interact in a variety of everyday settings: outside a liquor store, in a living room, fixing a car.

31041: August Rush is an orphan who uses his remarkable musical talent to seek the parents from whom he was separated at birth.

96767: In the late 1970s, when a mentally handicapped teenager is abandoned, a gay couple takes him in and becomes the family he’s never had. Once the unconventional living arrangement is discovered by authorities, they must fight a biased legal system to adopt the child they love.

28694: This second of three movie versions of P.C. Wren’s adventure novel “Beau Geste” is a virtual scene-for-scene remake of the 1927 silent version.

2461: A mentally-disturbed man takes residence in a halfway house. His mind gradually slips back into the realm created by his illness, where he replays a key part of his childhood.

2979: This film is the story of the spectacular life and violent death of British playwright Joe Orton. In his teens, Orton is befriended by the older, more reserved Kenneth Halliwell, and while the two begin a relationship, it’s fairly obvious that it’s not all about sex.

95408: Master explorer Dirk Pitt goes on the adventure of a lifetime of seeking out a lost Civil War battleship known as the “Ship of Death” in the deserts of West Africa while helping a UN doctor being hounded by a ruthless dictator.

168: Pivots around the unusual bond between a seasoned hitman who reluctantly takes on a 12-year-old girl as his protégée after her family is murdered. Features a breakout turn by a young Natalie Portman.

97459: A young mother tries to manage adolescence and her baby, the living memory of a first love with a not-so-happy ending. The child accompanies her everywhere: from coffee with friends to getting her nails done, confiding her life in front of the camera.

51674: This sequel to Disney’s hit film finds clumsy ape-man George perfectly content after having married the beautiful Ursula and fathering a child. But soon, all is not well in George’s jungle kingdom as Really Mean Lion challenges him for the throne.

25539: In 18th Century China, widowed Emperor Hsüan-tsung reigns alone, devoting his life to composing music. When he meets and falls in love with a beautiful young woman, who will become his imperial concubine, a tale of political intrigue and rival dynasties is set in motion, with tragic consequences.

27914: Award winning journalist John Pilger examines the role of Washington in America’s manipulation of Latin American politics during the last 50 years leading up to the struggle by ordinary people to free themselves from poverty and racism.

39070: In a Chechen city recovering after the war, a man disappears. As daily life goes on, those in search are drawn into a world where encounters with diviners and legal advisers, with the torturers and the tortured, with secret prisons and mythical lakes all become commonplace.

24763: The film is a repeated succession of interviews of characters who claim they have to protect horses from the fanatics. It is shot in television reportage style, with the characters looking directly into the camera.

21883: A group of rowdy young bikers party it up at a secluded farmhouse when, tormented by a mysterious force, things take a turn for the worst.

26732: Two distant cousins meet at a wedding banquet for an elderly couple. Over time, a close friendship develops between them, but their spouses begin to think that they are more than just friends.

45268: The Old Man and the Sea

24607: British flying aces in World War I contend with the harsh realities of war.

27870: The Acunas, a rich Argentine family, have the tradition that the daughters have to get married in order, oldest first. When sister #1 gets married, sisters #3 and #4 put pressure on Maria, sister #2, because they have their husbands picked out already.

22790: Two secretaries go out on a double date, but the inexperienced Mary flees when offered money for sexual favors. She takes refuge in a cafe and encounters a plebeian Prince Charming.

26656: A contemporary picaresque novel on a high level, in which questions of morality and society, desire and crime fight for supremacy. What use is a contemporary Robin Hood in the 21st century?

98409: A disfigured watchmaker with a grudge against society embarks on a life of crime.

22840: Two Italian racketeers come to Albania just after the fall of the communists to set up a fictive firm and pocket the grants. They need a stooge. They choose an old one in a jail : Spiro. But the youngest italian, Gino, once alone with Spiro, encounter a few problems.

21637: 28 years old freelencer writer Sakura Asuka wakes up tied in a protected white room located in an isolated ward of a psychiatric hospital.

26986: An under-appreciated salesman tries to get himself a promotion by coaching his company’s soccer team.

20811: A single father obsessed with murdering the hit-and-run driver who killed his only child, poses as a screenwriter to get close to an actress who was in the car. He feels prepared to kill the young woman as if she was the driver, but as his knowledge of her family grows, so does his empathy for them.

106233: Maria disappeared in Metropolis. Back in the city Freder remembers moments they spent together. He wanders in hoping to see her again.

25695: The story revolves around the passengers of a yachting trip in the Atlantic Ocean who, when struck by mysterious weather conditions, jump to another ship only to experience greater havoc on the open seas.

22558: A man needing money agrees to impersonate a nonexistent person who said he’d be committing suicide as a protest, and a political movement begins.

23702: Feckless aspiring architect Stéphane leaves his pregnant girlfriend for theater designer Sabine; Sabine in turn vainly attempts to overcome her violent obsession with an actor in her theater company. A game of emotional chutes and ladders ensues.

41002: The horrific legacy of World War I is explored in unnerving detail in this documentary by Yervant Gianikian and Angela Ricci Lucchi.

41886: Emma Woodhouse seems to be perfectly content, a loving father whom she cares for, friends, and a home. But Emma has a terrible habit – matchmaking. She cannot resist finding suitors for her friends, most of all Harriot Smith…

26066: It’s Alex’s first year at university and her world’s turned upside-down when she meets savvy and sexy Kiki. Despite her lover’s baggage the naïve freshman falls head over heels in love. But threatening their bliss is Kiki’s emotionally explosive brother.

45940: Romance between a Hong Kong prostitute and penniless American artist.

24037: This drama with incestual nuances features singer-songwriter turned director Serge Gainsbourg as Stan, a screenwriter who has seen much better days.

46737: On the night of a festival, Giovanni embarks on a train that takes him across the Milky Way. Joining him in this trip is his friend Campanella. Together they meet peculiar passengers as they travel to an uncertain destination.

59111: Jump in and buckle up for a wild ride in the fast lane of laughter in this sequel to one of the top action-adventure comedies ever!

26102: Charlie takes an odyssey through grief during a weekend in New York City. His encounters are planned and chance: a homeless man, a dying friend, the couple who lives (and noisily loves) in the flat above him, a bartender and a one-night-stand he follows home, and a tattooed stranger.

107989: As Korea’s biggest crime organization ‘Goldmoon’ expands its powers, Kang , the head of police investigation planning department, orders the undercover cop Ja-Seoung to participate in project “New World”, that will take down ‘Goldmoon’.

25309: When a wealthy old man appears to have been “frightened to death” by a cat, Miss Marple suspects one of his four relatives, all heirs to his estate, of his murder.

23132: A down on his luck French ex-paratrooper turned amateur boxer takes a job as a private secretary and bodyguard for a corrupt French banker who is on the run from French authorities.

40468: Trapped in an isolated gas station by a voracious Splinter parasite that transforms its still-living victims into deadly hosts, a young couple and an escaped convict must find a way to work together to survive this primal terror.

20339: Tale of torrid and forbidden love between Julie Christie and Alan Bates in the English countryside. Winner of the Palme d’Or in 1971.

43663: A voyage into the museum’s reserves, and part of the extra work involved to mount the expositions after the renovation of the Louvre in the 1980s, when the glass pyramid was added to the classic buildings.

104536: “Stand Clear of the Closing Doors” is the story of Ricky, a 13-year-old boy with autism, and his mother, Mariana. An undocumented immigrant from Mexico, Mariana works long days cleaning houses while Ricky, deeply imaginative but painfully isolated, struggles to cope.
Stand Clear of the Closing Doors

86721: To make the most of their meager retirement savings, a group of British seniors relocates to India to live out their golden years at the Marigold Hotel. But upon arrival, they discover that the once-lavish resort has wilted considerably.

23056: A 40-year-old man arrives in a mysteriously idyllic city with no memory of having traveled there, only to realize that there is something decidedly sinister about his emotionally sterile new home in director Jens Lien’s surreal, genre-jumping mystery.

21007: Standing in the Shadows of Motown

40970: Pretty as a Picture: The Art of David Lynch

45690: A manifesto of the Czechoslovak New Wave, this anthology of five short films by five rising directors is based on a book by the celebrated writer Bohumil Hrabal. Absurdist in style, with a heightened attention to the individual, Hrabal’s work broke with the socialist realism that dominated the era.

30787: Speeding trains slice through the silence of the small train stop. The whistle on the locomotive and the thunder of the wheels disappear into the night, but fail to wake up people at the station. People just continue to sleep. What do they wait for? What will wake them up?

132368: Twelve-year-old Simone (Sophie Nélisse) feels painfully disconnected from the world after witnessing the brutal death of her mother…

35867: Wordless (save for the song “Walking in the Air”) animated adventure about a young English boy who makes a snowman one Christmas Eve, only for it to come to life that night and take him on a magical adventure to the North Pole to meet Santa Claus.

590: At Christmas time in the 1940s, a young teenager comes of age in a rural Quebec mining town during a strike. Regularly cited by critics and scholars as the greatest Canadian film of all time.

28308: The film brilliantly recreates ancient Athens and the last days of the orator and philosopher Socrates with whom director Roberto Rossellini clearly identified.

34641: Apichatpong calls this a “Cinema Anthem” – designed to play at the start of a program, to bless what follows.

48825: Harvard public-policy major Monty Kessler finds himself in a pinch when his thesis ends up in the hands of Simon Wilder, a resourceful vagabond living in the university library’s basement.

29152: A one shot scene with Catherine E. Coulson as a woman attempting to write a letter while a female nurse (played by director David Lynch) tends to her leg stumps.

37836: Jeon Woo-chi, an undisciplined womanizing Taoist from the Joseon era, ends up in present day Korea causing mayhem with his knack for magic.

2680: Starting from childhood attempts at illustration, the protagonist pursues his true obsession to art school. But as he learns how the art world really works, he finds that he must adapt his vision to the reality that confronts him.
