6622: Federico Fellini’s darkest film cracks through the myth of Giacomo Casanova. As played by Donald Sutherland (M.A.S.H, Don’t Look Now), the notorious womanizer is presented as a pitiable and terrifying figure.

111569: Victoria wakes with a head-ache and bandaged wrists,pills spilled on the floor. A strange sign is flickering on the television but she can remember nothing.

37253: In 1994, Alexander Sokurov accompanied Russian troops assigned to a military post at the Tajikistan/Afghanistan border to film their experiences. While unnamed tribal forces occasionally engaged the troops in skirmishes, Sokurovs haunting documentary chronicles the downtime between activity.

92524: Elton John describes his crush on a beautiful GDR borderguard whom he cannot meet because he is not allowed into the country.

92958: A lonely woman invited a male stripper to her birthday party. A birthday party where he’s the only guest. He eats some cake, does a little dance, and just as he is about to leave, she shoves a fork into his throat. He slowly dies on her bed and becomes her new boyfriend.

34058: Sentenced to life imprisonment for illegal activities, Italian International member Giulio Manieri holds on to his political ideals while struggling against madness in the loneliness of his prison cell.

389: After a stroke, wealthy magazine editor Jean-Dominique Bauby is left almost entirely paralyzed.  Unable to move or speak, he retreats into his mind, but after learning to communicate by blinking his left eye, he begins to tell his story.  Based on true events.
The Diving Bell and the Butterfly

1993: Fast Eddie Felson teaches a cocky but immensely talented protégé the ropes of pool hustling, which in turn inspires him to make an unlikely comeback.

95939: To try out the idea of floating images in midair. An epxploration of time, filmed at night in the company dormitory in which the filmmaker was living.

5785: When an aspiring barber becomes involved in the theft of a diamond, necessity forces him to masquerade as a 12 year-old child.

32263: Sir Robert Chiltern is a successful Government minister, well-off and with a loving wife. All this is threatened when Mrs Cheveley appears in London with damning evidence of a past misdeed.

3612: The drama centers on a child named Bashu who, after his family and village are destroyed by the Iraqi Army, escapes to a farm run by a woman and her two children. The woman (who becomes Bashu’s adoptive mother) is left to fend for herself and her children in a difficult environment.

1643: Thomas, 32, suffers from acute agoraphobia. For eight years, he’s lived a reclusive life that no one is allowed to enter. He only communicates with the outside world via his computer screen. But his virtual partner Clara is not enough… An innovative and humourous first feature.

30232: The true story of a rich girl who was abducted by American revolutionaries in the 1970’s. Her time spent with her captors made her question herself and her way of life and she joined forces with the cause that her abductors were fighting for.

116508: After surviving Auschwitz, a former cabaret singer, her face disfigured and reconstructed, returns to her war-ravaged hometown to find the gentile husband who may or may not have betrayed her. Without recognizing her, he enlists her to play his wife in a bizarre hall-of-shattered-mirrors story…

95545: In Havana, Raul dreams of escaping to Miami. Accused of assault, he appeals to Elio to help him reach the forbidden world 90 miles across the ocean. One night, full of hope, they face the biggest challenge of their lives.

2834: The Wild and Wonderful Whites of West Virginia

31068: Set in an African village the film centres on a tribe whose culture is ruined by visitors from the west.

97968: A cross between a road-trip in Portugal and a summer love story, shot in super 8 film. It is the junction of a poetic narrative with factual and personal elements. Julian is represented here as the “noble savage” of Rousseau: nature is his natural environment.

108174: The basic premise of the script is a confrontation between a brother and sister, Nuno and Laura. They are very much alike. For different reasons they are on the same track: both get involved in impossible and forbiden relationships which they don’t dare to talk about.

29583: In 2003, Harvard computer genius Mark Zuckerberg begins work on what is to become the culture-changing global social network known as Facebook. Six years later, Zuckerberg has become the youngest billionare in history.

3776: A team of police hunt down a villain.

32307: A young Viking prince strives to become a knight in King Arthur’s Court and restore his exiled father to his rightful throne.

141: After reforming in prison, former neo-Nazi Derek Vineyard returns home after three years to find his younger brother on the verge of following in his criminal footsteps.

2950: He can deliver a breathtaking speech on the American soul to flabbergasted schoolboys, get mixed up in the private lives of his citizens, and even get his 18-year-old daughter to swear that never, but never, would she leave home.

1727: A pre-operative male-to-female transsexual takes an unexpected journey when she learns that she fathered a son, now a teenage runaway hustling on the streets of New York.

87329: A heavy shower of objects on a poor cellist. This street musician will stun you!

20873: A teacher is assigned to a remote desert village that is obsessed with a mysterious buried treasure and whose children are cursed to wander the desert.

22822: This film is dominated by an icy blue. In a monumental building a group of scientists submit women to obscure and inhuman experiments, in which sexuality and cruelty constantly merge into one another.

18293: For six months, a strangler has terrorized the city. Calling himself The Judge, he’s a self-appointed destroyer of ‘evil’ who only strikes on rainy nights. Police Lieut. Harry Grant is obsessed with catching him but has failed so far, despite varied clues.

26598: When hordes of vicious rats invade their town and begin stealing their jewelry, polluting their food, wrecking their homes, and attacking their persons, the cruel, avaricious, and gluttonous citizens of Hamelin agree to pay a wandering piper to rid them of the vermin.

43155: Kanichiro Yoshimura is a Samurai and Family man who can no longer support his wife and children on the the low pay he receives from his small town clan, he is forced by the love for his family to leave for the city in search of higher pay to support them.
When the Last Sword Is Drawn

44298: A family’s place in the wilderness, outside of time; free-range animals and children, junk and nature, all within the most sublime landscape.

23760: Adaptation from the play by Oscar Wilde.

99755: In Chile, an American tourist’s vacation goes from good to great when he meets some beautiful women travellers. But when an earthquake ravages the underground nightclub they’re in, a fun night quickly turns to terror.

21731: Is it a prescient work forecasting the Bono era of celebrity-charity whoring, or is it a malicious and misogynist dig at Jane Fonda, who starred in Tout va bien alongside Yves Montand?
Letter to Jane: An Investigation About a Still

124013: David, an orderly at a hospital, tells his horrific story of being kidnapped and forced to play a vile game of survival.

84046: After a series of mysterious disasters occurs in the Pacific, from the disappearance of a plane to the destruction of an oil rig, a group of scientists discovers that a secret military mission has unearthed a prehistoric shark and a giant octopus.

27976: Four college pledges are forced to spend the night in a deserted old mansion where they get killed off one by one by the monstrous surviving members of a family massacre years earlier for trespassing on their living grounds.

22696: Drawing from the influences of Georges Méliès, Jean Vigo, Buster Keaton, and Franz Kafka, noted German filmmaker Veit Helmer directs this atmospheric, darkly comic film about attendants at a public swimming pool.

99885: When Kondo, a wealthy contract killer accidentally hits his head in a bathhouse, an unemployed actor named Sakurai switches their locker keys. Sakurai takes on Kondo’s identity, while Kondo, who is suffering from amnesia, assumes the impoverished life of Sakuria…

24701: When New York attorney Gordon Hocheiser meets Louise Callan, the girl of his dreams, he schemes to eliminate his aging, senile mother, even though he promised his late father that he’d always take care of her.

25843: Some time in the future, East and West have stopped maintaining standing armies and nuclear weapons. Instead, to settle their differences they pit different teams of crack combat specialists against each other.

26634: Sixteen-year-old Jonas fails his exams again but thinks he can devote himself professionally to tennis. He fails the national competition. He meets 30-year-old Pierre, who is moved by his situation, and decides to help him.

19365: Opportunistic polish mercenary Kowalski forges a flimsy alliance with clueless revolutionary Paco in order to take down an abusive mine owner. Their different world views and objectives clash and things get personal when another mercenary, Curly, enters the picture.

24665: Director Pier Paolo Pasolini interviews a variety of Italians and asks them questions about love, marriage, infidelity, prostitution and homosexuality.

21985: James Bond, Agent 007, is sent to Jamaica to investigate the mysterious disappearance of a British secret service agent.

8507: A mute gunslinger faces off against a gang of bounty hunters in the great blizzard of 1899, and a grim, tense struggle unfolds.

118581: A catholic French couple sees their life upside down when their four daughters get married to men of different religion and origins.

3659: An escaped Devil’s Island convict uses miniaturized humans to wreak vengeance on those that framed him.

96705: The farm of tomorrow proves to be filled with wacky inventions and crazy cross-breeding.

2403: Pollet’s seminal Mediterranee cuts repeatedly between meditative camera movements around various subjects–Greek ruins, a Sicilian garden, a Spanish bullfight, a woman on a hospital cart, a fisherman–conjuring up a great many mysteries about their relation to one another.

89047: Virgile and Blanche, both seventeen, send e-mails to one another from their respective bedrooms. The young man has only seen the young woman once, but has fallen madly in love with her. He uses email to relay his feelings to her.

30279: Imagine having all the power, passion and pleasure money can buy. Now imagine losing them.

52579: In this fact-based film, Sally Field plays Betty Mahmoody, an American housewife who finds herself virtually trapped in Tehran when she accompanies her Iranian husband on a vacation to his homeland — and he decides to relocate the family.

116543: Alice Howland, happily married with three grown children, is a renowned linguistics professor who starts to forget words. When she receives a devastating diagnosis, Alice and her family find their bonds tested.

93499: Three friends are asked to be bridesmaids at a wedding of a woman they used to ridicule back in high school.

33116: A worker at a Russian nuclear facility gets exposed to a lethal dose of radiation. In order to provide for his family, he steals some plutonium and sets out to sell it on Moscow’s black market with the help of an incompetent criminal.

35081: When a terrorist’s body, infected with a stolen chemical, is recovered by the US military, the corpse is cremated…

52861: This anime adventure takes place in the mythical realm of Gaea, where sword, sorcery, blood and violence settle disputes. Thrust into a conflict she doesn’t quite understand, Hitomi comes to the aid of a young warrior king named Van.

89123: Johan lives with his wife in the eastern suburb of Stockholm. Anna lives there too, with her husband and nine-year-old daughter. They do not know each other, but a car accident – which involves Johan and causes the death of the little girl – will totally devastate their lives.

31147: Based on a novel by Karel Capek, this classic of the Czech cinema is, in more than one way, a precursor to Dr. Strangelove. Beautifully filmed in black and white, the haunting imagery and the brooding, damp atmosphere leave an indelible impression on its viewers.

53647: Do-gooder identical twins Mary-Kate and Ashley Olsen take matters into their own hands and try to find a special someone for their lonely widower father.

93651: Sherlock and John investigate the ghosts of a young man who has been seeing monstrous hounds out in the woods where his father died.

48: World famous French director Claire Denis looks for parallels between her own work and that of Mathilde Monnier, France’s foremost choreographer, as she documents the birth, formulation, and performance of a radical new dance piece.

92877: Whenever Lucas can’t sleep he hops into Danilo’s bed. The boy has been living with his brother since the death of his parents. But, in fact, Danilo already shares his bed with somebody else.

5506: 1938, Romania: at 70, a professor of language and philosophy, Dominic Matei, contemplates suicide: the love of his life is dead, and he remains unable to complete his life’s work on the origins of language.

91600: Hayley Mills plays twins who, unknown to their divorced parents, meet at a summer camp. Products of single parent households, they switch places (surprise!) so as to meet the parent they never knew, and then contrive to reunite them.

49051: Lady and Tramp have settled down with a pup of their own in this sequel to Disney’s classic canine romance. Young Scamp is certainly his father’s son: Bored with life at home, he longs for adventure on the mean streets his father once roamed.
Lady and the Tramp II: Scamp's Adventure

14200: To save her ill son, a field mouse must seek the aid of a colony of rats, with whom she has a deeper link than she ever suspected.

91764: Anna has a secret ambition of becoming an actor. She falls in love, becomes pregnant and gives birth to a baby girl. Her struggle to combine her dream of acting and giving her daughter a good start in life culminates in a desperate act with fatal consequences for mother and daughter alike.

29700: 70-year-old Axun doesn’t get along with her husband, her daughter, or her friends. She lives out her monotonous days on a farm, until the day she comes across Maite again, someone she hasn’t seen for fifty years…

35249: The down-at-heel lodger in a seaside boarding house is menaced by two mysterious strangers, who eventually take him away.

68018: To prove himself in the cutthroat world of the U.S. Naval Academy, a struggling freshman trained in the school of hard knocks enters a fiercely competitive boxing contest — but does he have what it takes to make it?

34013: A 50-year-old man is transported back into the body of his adolescent self, perhaps allowing him to solve the mystery of his father’s disappearance. Sam Garbarski brings Jiro Taniguchi’s manga comic to 1960s France. Air provides the soundtrack.

35715: Loosely — very loosely — based on the life of Hungarian Countess Elizabeth Báthory de Ecsed (1560 – 1614), who, legend has it, bathed in the blood of virgins to maintain her youth.

88891: A 3D-animated movie set in Paris in the year 1910 and centered on a monster who lives in a garden and his love for a beautiful, young singer.

28006: When red tape stops New York firefighter Larry from naming his children as beneficiaries of his pension, he asks his best friend Chuck to enter into domestic partnership with him. Now, they must convince everyone that their ‘marriage’ is real… even their gorgeous lawyer.
I Now Pronounce You Chuck & Larry

37744: Alexandre Astruc made this short for TV based on Edgar Allan Poe’s The Pit and the Pendulum. Sentenced to death by the Spanish Inquisition in the early nineteenth century, a man is incarcerated in a prison in Toledo.

30489: A crash course on the history of Western musical instruments.

36806: When an alien spacecraft of enormous power is spotted approaching Earth, Admiral Kirk resumes command of the Starship Enterprise in order to intercept, examine and hopefully stop the intruder.

30991: On the day of his marriage, Ichiro Kure kills the bride, goes insane as a result and loses his memory. In the hospital he becomes the victim of the professors’ ambitions and lives from now on in a world of fear and horrifying visions.

4200: A young mother (played brilliantly by Maria Bonnevie) struggles with a history of drug abuse in this exquisitely rendered and deeply compassionate piece, the first fiction film from one of Norway’s most respected documentary filmmakers.

68420: This offshoot of the raunchy American Pie imprint stars John White as Erik Stifler, the virginal cousin and polar opposite of Matt and Steve Stifler, who decides to abstain from sex with his girlfriend until they’re ready.
American Pie Presents: The Naked Mile

88589: A widower returns to his hometown to search for answers to his wife’s murder, which may be linked to the ghost of a murdered ventriloquist.

153875: Edina and Patsy are still oozing glitz and glamor, living the high life they are accustomed to. Blamed for a major incident at an uber fashionable launch party, they become entangled in a media storm and are relentlessly pursued by the paparazzi.

15462: A filmmaker’s (Eusebio Poncela) sexual disorientation jeopardizes his latest project in this class film from director Pedro Almodóvar. Carmen Maura and Antonio Banderas co-star.

34857: Hester Street tells the story of Jewish immigrants who come to the Lower East side of New York City in 1896 from Europe and who live on Hester Street in Manhattan.

456: Mouchette is an adolescent living in the rough countryside. Her mother is dying and her father is absent. Remaining silent in the face of the humiliations she undergoes she finds respite in the woods. Everything changes when she meets poacher, Arsene.

10452: Jones Dillon (Elijah Wood) is a young writer who is living on his own for the first time. Jones continually writes letters to the father he has never met, while his mother Blanche (Elizabeth Perkins) resides in Texas.

108463: A rogue paramilitary group seizes control of the White House and threatens to kill the president if their demands are not met, yet one White House police officer attempts to foil their plans.

29094: Short abstract animation from visual music pioneer Oskar Fischinger.

3261: In the Pacific Northwest during the 1950’s, two young sisters whose mother has abandoned them wind up living with their Aunt Sylvie, whose views of the world and its conventions don’t quite live up the most people’s expectations.

32610: Father and son bring their painful past into their isolated present for 24 hours.

33952: What makes a country a country?  Documentarian Jody Shapiro visits six unrecognized “micro-nations”, from Sealand (on an abandoned gun tower in the North Sea) to the 1.3 acre Republic of Molossia to find out…
How to Start Your Own Country

133190: A boy seeks the help of a tree monster to cope with his single mom’s terminal illness.

32774: British agents in WWII Crete hatch a daring and ambitious plan to capture the Commander of the island’s occupying German forces.

37894: A documentary feature examining why over 3,000 independent record stores have closed across the U.S. in the past decade. Many sources all pose threats on the very well being of our favorite record stores. Will these stores die or will they survive?
I Need That Record! The Death (or Possible Survival) of the Independent Record Store

31903: During one unusually hot and tragic weekend, four people struggle after hearing some life-changing news, this in turn brings them together.

532: The controversial poet, novelist, and filmmaker transposes the Marquis de Sade’s eighteenth-century opus of torture and degradation to Italy in 1944 where four corrupted fascist libertines round up nine teenagers and subject them to 120 days of sadistic physical, mental and sexual torture.
Salò, or the 120 Days of Sodom

102403: A documentary on Louise and Martine Fokkens, 69-year-old twin sisters who have worked as prostitutes in the red-light district in Amsterdam for over 40 years.

42983: A love grows from a chance encounter between Chris and Aurore. They are twenty years old and their passion is exclusive. It’s a beautiful love story like you see in the movies… But then Aurore discovers that Chris is a killer.

25163: The story of a little creature created by genetic experimentation and bound to prison with his evil creator. Stitch escapes and heads for Earth where he tries to impersonate a dog and gets adopted by little Lilo.

101608: Still haunted by his unwanted abilities, which allows him to enter other people’s dreams, and memories of his mother dying when he was a child, Kyoichi Kagenuma (Ryuhei Matsuda) contemplates suicide while slowly drowns in his world of misery.

26368: A sarcastic story about a thief who becomes the victim of his own victims. His victims come from the other world and take his most precious posession – his blood. The phantasmal atmosphere of the film is achieved through artificial animation colouring in a motion picture.

19639: Neurosurgeon/Rock Star/Superhero Buckaroo has perfected the oscillation overthruster, which allows him to travel through solid matter by using the eighth dimension, but the Red Lectroids from Planet 10 are after this device for their own evil ends.
The Adventures of Buckaroo Banzai Across the 8th Dimension

25007: The film begins with a violent murder committed by some school children/teenagers after a fist fight and chase.

45756: One former cop goes against the whole Mafia.

123682: Two brothers find themselves lost in a mysterious land and try to find their way home.

107557: “Look, if you let anyone else make this film, I’ll kill myself,” director Shane Meadows announced to cult Manchester rock band The Stone Roses. The band gave him the thumbs up and we now have before us an energetic documentary tracking the band’s reunion…
The Stone Roses: Made of Stone

126962: A story of lost love, young love, a legendary sword and one last opportunity at redemption.
Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon: Sword of Destiny

86937: The saga of some Copacabana dwellers: Sônia Silk, a prostitute also known as Miss Prado Júnior and Peroxide Beast; her gay brother, addicted to smelling his boss’s underwear; and Mr. Grillo, the boss.

42737: The documentary follows the journey of Patty Schemel, the openly gay drummer of Courtney Love’s seminal rock band Hole.

45886: The true story of João Guilherme Estrella (“Johnny”), a young middle-class bon vivant who became a big-time cocaine dealer in Rio de Janeiro in the early 1990s.

43911: A man and a woman meet in the hospital after their respective partners are involved in a car accident. After learning that their spouses have been having an affair, the two begin one of their own.

103989: After R (a highly unusual zombie) saves Julie from an attack, the two form a relationship that sets in motion a sequence of events that might transform the entire lifeless world.

21309: Based on his psycho-therapist’s advice, the owner of a reception hall has decided to close down the hall in 20 days, since there are more mourning receptions held in the hall than weddings. The workers, whose very livelihoods depend on the hall, try hard to stop the closing.

23358: For those who were young, living under the delusions of love and soft drugs in Paris, May 1968 – even if the guitar is still playing, they can’t hear it any longer.
I Can No Longer Hear the Guitar

41458: A made-for-television trilogy set in the same New York City hotel room, focusing on different characters during different decades — the 30s, 60s, and 90s — written and produced by David Lynch, who also directs two of the segments.

40602: Topsy, the famous “Baby” elephant, was electrocuted at Coney Island on January 4, 1903.

12448: The lone stranger roams the West, dragging a coffin filled with chaos towards a destiny ruled by vengeance. Sergio Corbucci packs his landmark classic with indelible images, unforgettable performances, and some of the most shocking brutality of any Spaghetti Western ever made.

53350: First coming to the attention of the American masses as a mid-1990s “Saturday Night Live” regular, Chris Rock later skyrocketed to the status of A-list, million-dollar-salary celebrity with high-profile movie roles and a regular show on HBO.

35596: A social misfit, Willard is made fun of by his co-workers, and squeezed out of the company started by his deceased father by his boss. His only friends are a couple of rats he raised at home, Ben and Socrates.

155679: The beginning of the pontificate of Lenny Belardo, aka Pius XIII, is the first American Pope in history. Consisting of eight episodes of Miniseries.

89848: Dexter Fletcher’s low budget directorial debut is a hugely impressive achievement, with a whip smart script and authoritative performances from some of Britain’s finest acting talent.

2070: Scandal causes a powerful Mexican rancher to declare a bounty on the head of Alfredo Garcia. A piano player hears of the reward through two bounty hunters, and sets off to claim the money for himself.
Bring Me the Head of Alfredo Garcia

13776: The plot of the film is an elaborately constructed fever dream. The film begins by introducing the viewer to Stefan and Valerie, a young couple who were recently married after not knowing each other for very long.

2114: Ben Hopkins’ documentary 37 Uses for a Dead Sheep provides a warm, benevolent, and occasionally humorous glimpse at the lifestyles, mores, and background of the Pamir Kirghiz, a nomadic tribe from the central Asia.

579: This sumptuous Technicolor rendering of Shakespeare’s play features a thrilling recreation of the battle of Agincourt, and Sir Laurence Olivier in his prime as director and actor.

33565: Mousie and Sad Girl are childhood best friends in a contemporary Los Angeles poor Hispanic neighborhood. But when Sad Girl becomes pregnant by Mousie’s boyfriend, a drug dealer named Ernesto, the two become bitter enemies.

4083: Set in early 19th century France, Sobran Jodeau is an ambitious young peasant winemaker with three loves in his life—his beautiful and passionate wife Celeste, the proudly intellectual baroness Aurora de Valday and Xas, an angel who strikes up an unlikely friendship with Sobran.

29217: An improvisational comedy using a handful of actors playing characters competing in an actual poker tournament.

113100: Indiana, 1817. The entire nation, only 40 years old and a few years removed from a second war of independence, is still raw. This is young Abraham Lincoln’s world.

91317: Godina was given almost limitless resources in the form of 20,000 troops, 60 tanks and 20 airplanes. Clearly the promised film would be some massive epic on the scale of Triumph of the Will, but the film ended being about “enjoying the summer fun.’
About the Art of Love or a Film with 14441 Frames

56360: Godzilla finally meets his match in Mechagodzilla — an amped-up version of himself — in this film directed by Jun Fukuda that’s a favorite among die-hard fans. This doppelganger is stronger, deadlier and hellbent on destroying anything in its path.

28129: Paulino and Carmela are husband and wife, troubadours touring the countryside during the Spanish Civil War. They are Republicans, and with their mute assistant, Gustavete, they journey into rebel territory by mistake.

17804: Lyedecker is the Arizona lawman who travels to Mexico in search of Yaqui Joe. Joe has made an illegal withdrawal of $6,000 from the band in Phoenix to help finance his tribes’s uprising against the Mexican government. Sarita is the local woman who is friendly towards the Indian leaders.

14673: Well-to-do Chicagoan, Larry Darrell, breaks off his engagement to Isabel and travels the world seeking enlightenment, eventually finding his guru India

11993: A string of gags based on  20s-style animation and the self-reflexiveness of Windsor McCay’s surreal comic strips from the same period. While the gags are familiar, the extent to which Tezuka pushes the medium’s break-down is quite extreme.

119004: When the girl of your dreams is half your age, it’s time to grow up.

41577: Idiosyncratic Japanese auteur Takashi Miike offers another meditation on a violent culture in this teen-themed thriller.

9082: Rusty James is an up-and-coming street hoodlum, lamenting the old school days of the gangs when his older brother, The Motorcycle Boy, ran things as President of the Packers.

99326: A town is Portugal – life is poverty, 13-year-old Jaime leads a busy life, although he obviously has to go to school. His mother is dissolute and his father, who left her, cannot find a job. Thus, Jaime is the breadwinner…

42618: A young hot shot driver is in the middle of a championship season and is coming apart at the seams. A former CART champion is called in to give him guidance.

106622: Mythology and belief in society today, presenting uncommon perspectives of common cultural issues.

25284: When his college dreams are sidelined by family obligations, a young man finds comfort in surfing with his best friend’s brother.

101993: In a futuristic city, Detectives Monday and Tuesday pursue a wanted criminal.

126431: Vincent is an ex-soldier with PTSD who is hired to protect the wife and child of a wealthy Lebanese businessman while he’s out of town. Despite the apparent tranquility on Maryland, Vincent perceives an external threat.

47628: A retelling of Dragon Ball’s origin with a different take on the meeting of Goku, Bulma, and Kame-Sen’nin. It also retells the Red Ribbon Army story; but this time they find Goku rather than Goku finding them.
Dragon Ball: The Path to Power

102448: An underachieving vocal coach is motivated by her father, the king of movie-trailer voice-overs, to pursue her aspirations of becoming a voiceover star. Amidst pride, sexism and family dysfunction, she sets out to change the voice of a generation.

46472: A French boy (Daniel) and an American girl (Lauren), who goes to school in Paris, meet and begin a little romance. They befriend Julius who enchants them with his story telling. In an attempt to solidify the teens’ love forever, the three journey to Venice.

26323: A young man is faced with a dilemma when a threatening figure from his past returns in this drama.

45679: Lei Li lost his right-arm in a sword duel with the master of a martial arts school, long ago. Now, he is able to defend himself well with just his left arm, and kung fu techniques. That he proves with just the help of his friend Chung-Chieng, when he crosses his path with a beautiful girl in need, P

44547: Donald finds out what happens when his dreams come true and he finally gets married to Daisy.

26247: A secret love affair between a bank manager and an employee’s wife leads to unexpected consequences.

26605: The night he splits up with his girlfriend, the lonely Kafka meets a young financial manager, who has moved to Hong Kong from Australia in order to help pick up the pieces after the financial crisis of autumn 2008.

103334: Charlotte Gainsbourg plays Joe, a self-diagnosed nymphomaniac, who is found badly beaten by a man named Seligman. As she’s nursed back to health, Joe recounts her sexual life history from girlhood to present day.

27823: A man kills his wife on their wedding night, after discovering she had been unfaithful. After being acquitted, he moves to the country, where he falls in love with an innocent girl.

41299: A tough-minded drama about two friends in South Central Los Angeles and the violence that comes between them.

24654: Merlin, a transvestite, and Sanela, a prostitute, share a home in the suburbs of Belgrade. Dzoni, who has returned from fighting on the Bosnian front gets to know them. A bit of sex is what he needs to overcome political violence and macho aggression.

23599: Like her older sisters before her, Thérèse Martin is determined to become a Carmelite nun even though she is officially too young to enter the order. Thérèse’s stubborn piety wins through, and her love affair with Jesus transfigures her short life.

26761: The film is set in the distant future in a city called Cahmpon. A scientist creates a synthetic life-form called Noiseman, which erases music from the airwaves by turning it into crystals. A group of Biker street kids rebels against this tyranny.

44061: Documentary on the life of composer Dmitri Shostakovich, chronicled through personal documents and performances, as well as archival footage of daily life in the Soviet Union.

23881: Clint Ramsey has to leave his job working at Martin Bormann’s gas station and flee after his wife is murdered by psycho cop Harry Sledge, who tries to pin the murder on Clint. Crossing America, Clint is sexually harassed on all sides by various voluptuous nymphomaniacs…

38279: A portrait of the construction workers involved in building the second deck of Mexico City’s Periferico freeway.

120248: They call him Koza, the goat. His best days as a boxer are behind him. Sometimes he re-watches the video of his fight at the 1996 Olympics. Now he needs money because his girlfriend is pregnant.

27947: A 1975 Polish film directed by Andrzej Wajda, based on a novel by Władysław Reymont. Set in the industrial city of Łódź, The Promised Land tells the story of a Pole, a German, and a Jew struggling to build a factory in the raw world of 19th century capital

23751: “Whity” is the mulatto butler of the dysfunctional Nicholson family in the American southwest in 1878.

20926: A documentary about one of Britain’s most dangerous crime families and introduces us to its magnetic, larger-than-life leader, Dominic Noonan (aka Lattlay Fottfoy).

22977: The prisoner R arrives to Denmark’s toughest prison, where he is to serve a sentence for violent assault. R is reduced to a number, a letter, just another inmate.

21700: During a war in an imaginary country, unscrupulous soldiers recruit poor farmers with promises of an easy and happy life. Two of these farmers write to their wives of their exploits.

20842: Daniel, a young 34-year-old from Seville, is the first European man with Down syndrome to have earned a university diploma. He starts his working life with the public administration where he meets Laura, a workmate with no apparent disability. And he falls in love with her.

23635: A bold, offbeat biography of the great Viennese philosopher, Ludwig Wittgenstein, personalised in Derek Jarman’s unique style to address the politics and sexuality of the troubled intellectual.

22813: A father and his three sons inherit a fortune which affords them the luxury of complete leisure. Together with a devoted and lovely maid, they move to a remote country estate.
The Idlers of the Fertile Valley

1595: Clever and ingenious film from Austria in which a series of diverse characters are pursued by fate. Or how grand themes can be presented with treacherous lightness.

153000: Filmmaker Leo is searching for the wolf in the south of France. During a scouting excursion he is seduced by Marie, a free-spirited and dynamic shepherdess. Nine months later she gives birth to their child…

29731: Will and Jake Grimm dazzle small towns with their imaginative folklore and elaborate illusions, but when the brothers journey into a real enchanted forest they encounter many of the fantastic characters and thrilling situations found in their beloved fairy tales.

57860: After the devastation of World War III, the scattered governments of the world construct the perfect city — a cyberpunk metropolis called Olympus — administered by Biodroids — artificially created half-human half-robots.

79: Two brothers quarrel for the love of a woman. One of them falls ill and dies; the other one marries her.  The couple’s relationship falters in Paris due to the involvement of a reproaching mother, who still acts as if the dead brother were alive and living with her.

30080: In an amazingly beautiful place, on the bank of the wide Don, in a remote, half-destroyed village, an unexpected passionate love between a young man and a married woman literally destroys their lives as well as the lives of their loved ones.

132813: Inspired by a true story, features two aging whores who, using eye drops, accidentally kill two dwarf brothers who work as lucha libre mascots. Truth is indeed sometimes stranger than fiction.

16304: Jenny, still dangerously attractive after five years in prison for killing a man in defense of her lover Harry, clashes with parole officer Griff, who’s determined to make her go straight. She continues to meet Harry, but when she transfers her affections to Griff, the situation becomes dangerous.

92846: Bargeman Louveau finds an abandoned boy, Victor, and with the authorities permission takes him back to his own family where he raises him. 10 years later Victor and Louveau’s daughter Clara have fallen in love.

34146: A champagne tycoon’s (Furneaux) partner (Ronet) suspects his partner’s gigolo husband (Perkins) of murders he’s been framed for.

297: The concluding chapter of Roberto Rossellini’s War Trilogy is the most devastating, a portrait of an obliterated Berlin shown through the eyes of a twelve-year-old boy.

2556: An explicit depiction of the last twelve hours in the life of Jesus. The languages spoken in the film are Arabic, Latin and Hebrew and its actors are laymen which among one of the elements controversially received.

31176: Five people get lost in a crypt and meet up with a strange crypt keeper who tells them stories of how they died.

13334: A mother and her 6 year old daughter move into a creepy apartment whose every surface is permeated by water.

94601: Testing the contours of censorship (it was immediately banned), Andrade’s small erotic milestone centres on a man whose objects of desire are fresh fruits and vegetables – the riper the better!

2432: Cristi is a policeman who refuses to arrest a young man who offers hashish to two of his school mates. Cristi believes that the law will change, he does not want the life of a young man to be a burden on his conscience. For his superior the word conscience has a different meaning…

95943: A film about Takashi Ito’s 5 year old son, Ryuta. The author sometimes wonder what this small person means to him. Even though he sees joy and sadness and knows the feel of his warmth on his skin when holding him, his feelings for him become sometimes vague or blank.

96734: A hypnotizing exploration of polarities: stillness and motion, 2D and 3D, positive and negative, color and black-and-white, day and night.

3668: Matt Damon plays an amnesiac who is fished out the sea and nursed back to health, only to find himself trailed by a group of assassins, prompting him to seek out his true identity. Loosely based on the novels by Robert Ludlum.

37185: C.S. Lewis, a world-renowned writer and professor, leads a passionless life until he meets spirited poet Joy Gresham.

30248: Ali Osman is a former bully in Istanbul. But lately he gives up being bully and starts to operate a synthetic pitch. He often meets his old friends, former bullies, too. One day Ali Osman receives a news which is related with his previous life, which starts a whole chain of events.

1639: Paris in 1977. Eleven-year-old Stella lives in a working-class neighborhood. Her parents run a bar and she attends a prestigious Parisian school, where she meets Gladys. Through the books that Stella discovers at her friend’s house, she slowly enters another dimension – real life.

50965: This fictionalized account of the real lives of three notorious and influential Harlem drug dealers is told in flashbacks as Harris’s character, Ace, becomes slowly immersed in the world of hustling.

117728: It starts with a guy trying to get a girl he met at a party to like him. She refuses but he doesn’t give up and story continues in a long and interesting conversations between them during which he manages to gain her attention.

53712: This lyrical movie, directed by Kei Kuwai and based on a script by the legendary Akira Kurosawa, chronicles the lives of two women at a brothel in ancient Japan. O-Shin cuts through class divisions by falling in love with a young samurai.

48196: Romania, 1986: Gregor and Vali want to get away. They need each other, yet there is mutual distrust. One night Gregor’s doubts are confirmed. In the end, all he has is hope.

127262: A woman who survived the brutal killing of her family as a child is forced to confront the events of that day by a secret society obsessed with solving notorious crimes.

79686: A white-collar criminal, an eccentric transsexual, a cannibalistic idiot savant and a cerebral wife-killer share a prison cell, where they find a century-old journal that may hold the key to escaping.

87237: New Yorker Brandon lives in a high-rise apartment and has a well- paying job. He is also a sex addict who hides his shame behind this facade of respectability. The unexpected arrival of his wayward sister threatens to unravel everything.

9993: The plot finds Doc Holliday and Billy the Kid becoming partners in a lawless land. Their tenuous friendship is challenged by constant quarrels, first over Doc’s horse, Red, then over Doc’s girl, Rio.

44386: Goofy plans a relaxing day at rest, but he needs a second tree at his penthouse apartment to hang his hammock. So, he brings one back from the forest only to find it includes a mountain lion who wants some rest as well.

22424: Shin is a Japanese university student living a boring and meaningless life. One day, he spots a book titled Dangerous Ways to Walk the World, in which he finds a page written about hazards in New-York. Eager to get out, he jets off to New-York to find this inspiration.

101082: John McClane travels to Russia to help out his seemingly wayward son, Jack, only to discover that Jack is a CIA operative working undercover, causing the father and son to team up against underworld forces.
A Good Day to Die Hard

20475: More fun with David Lynch and crew as they travel the country, capturing the faces and stories of unknown but fascinating Americans.

22858: “Animation. The mystical Lady with the orbital head moves through the carnival of life in a Surreal Adventure. A classic. Show it to anyone who likes movies.” – Larry Jordan

45314: Mickey, Donald, and Pluto climb up into the Alps in search of eagle’s eggs and edelweiss – leading to violent conflict with a mother eagle and a mountain goat.

27414: Three postal workers and their dysfunctional families interact over cups of tea and Sunday dinner.

25839: George Harrison’s friends, family and bandmates unite for a tribute concert on the one-year anniversary of his death.

27868: A pioneering short using digital animation.

25445: Seven disgusting kids but nevertheless of interesting personality are being made of the green mud coming out of garbage can. Once alive their master gives them rules to obey although they think that life is funnier without following stupid regulations like no television or no candy.

99483: Richard, an unemployed 55-year-old, arrives three minutes late for his appointment at a job centre. An advisor, stifled by the limits of the system she works in, has no choice but to penalize him for his tardiness. To avoid plunging further into destitution, Richard takes desperate measures.

25521: Will Graham is an FBI agent who brought down Hannibal Lecter. After retiring from the Bureau, he moves to Florida. Then a grisly murderer, “The Tooth Fairy,” starts killing entire families, covering the victims’ eyes with bits of shattered mirror, and Graham is asked to return to duty to find him.

10174: Eddie Bracken plays the son of a World War I Marine hero who is the first in his small town to sign up for military service. When Bracken is discharged from the Marines for hay fever, he hasn’t the nerve to go home and tell his mother and the rest of the townsfolk.

170: Set against the windswept tundra of Minnesota, a car salesman plans to wipe out his personal debts by hiring a pair of colorful crooks to kidnap his wife and have her wealthy father pay the ransom. The haphazard scheme turns sour during a routine pull-over that leaves three dead bodies in its wake.

3747: Kaspar Hauser lives locked in a cellar, where he cannot see or speak to anyone. One day, a mysterious man pulls him out, teaches him to walk and talk, and then leaves him in the middle of a town square with a letter in his hand addressed to the authorities. Kaspar’s journey begins…

30367: Regarded to be the first animated film.

88303: A woman looks on indcessantly in a demonstration of love.

1716: Encounters at the End of the World

2961: The material and spiritual sides of one man’s life are reflected in a game that allowed him to become a hero in this historical drama from Chinese director Tian Zhuangzhuang.

95410: A bored rich young man, makes a contract with a man in Hong Kong so that he will die in 30 days. However, he falls in love and tries to break the contract.

32252: By night, debonair newspaper publisher Britt Reid fights crime as a masked superhero known as The Green Hornet. At his side is martial arts expert Kato.

3623: A family saga: In a stunning mountain valley ranch setting near Aspen, complex and dangerous family dynamics play out against the backdrop of the first big snowstorm of winter and an enormous panther with seemingly mythical qualities which is killing cattle.

95908: As the nation states Euromerica and New Shanghai vie for supremacy, a factory worker (Farrell) begins to suspect that he’s a spy, though he is unaware which side of the fight he’s on.

33008: The story is framed as a series of reminiscences by aging scriptwriter Haru (Kobayashi, no doubt a substitute for Shindo himself, who also wrote and produced the film), who has isolated himself somewhere in the woods of Nagano Prefecture to work on his first novel.

1672: In this Academy Award-winning parable about the dysfunctional life of a seemingly perfect suburban family, complications arise when the father starts to develop feelings for his teenage daughter’s cheerleader best friend.

30203: After being brutally murdered in a gangster-style execution, Kensuke Hagane finds himself brought back to life by a mad scientist and rebuilt as a robot-human hybrid with a serious thirst for vengeance.

48271: World War 2 comedy about a submarine commander who finds himself stuck with a decrepit (and pink) sub, a con-man executive officer and a group of army nurses.

36038: Young boy, Ah-Jiang, a school failure and day dreamer witnesses the kidnapping of a child. After being taken hostage by a corrupt family, he begins an unusual adventure away from home.

89391: A young clerk, disappointed in love in early life passes his life in paper work. He centres his interests in a new overcoat but is robbed and assaulted on the way home, and dies of shock.

113975: In a recycling plant in the North of France, the workers join to sing in choir, and even trucks join them and make almost a ballet. From the functioning of the prodigious machines up to the manual labor of sorting, the film shows the process of recycling.

37262: An artist grows distant from his new wife as an irrational horror of premature burial consumes him.

35233: As Japan gears up for the 1964 Olympic games, the cops start to crack down under pressure from the public and the press.

34069: Victor and Hillary are down on their luck to the point that they allow tourists to take guided tours of their castle.

17071: This modern fairy tale tells of Totò who, found in a cabbage patch, is adopted by a wise and kind old woman named Lolotta. When she dies, he ends up in a shantytown on the outskirts of Milan.  But the ghost of Lolotta visits him, and offers a special gift…

28520: A champion of a brutal cross-country car race of the future where pedestrians are run down for points.

130809: A documentary tackling the future of the Italian Communist Party and the future, if any, of a socialistic utopia.

32: Director Avi Lewis, one of Canada’s most outspoken journalists, and writer Naomi Klein, author of the international bestseller “No Logo,” champion a radical economic manifesto for the 21st century.

37306: A career driven professional from Manhattan is wooed by a young painter, who also happens to be the son of her psychoanalyst.

3897: After an all-night send-off party for the troops, a small-town girl wakes up to find herself married and pregnant, but with no memory of her husband’s identity.

110666: Chérif is 15, a rebellious and solitary teenager. Unable to cope, his mother decides to send him to live with his aunt and uncle in Strasbourg, where he must pick up his vocational training to become a builder. It’s his last chance.

28838: Three penniless artists become friends in modern-day Paris: Rodolfo, an Albanian painter with no visa, Marcel, a playwright and magazine editor with no publisher, and Schaunard, a post-modernist composer of execrable noise.

31291: An announcement that the venerable Bunker Hill Military Academy is to be torn down and replaced with condos sets off the young cadets led by their stodgy commander. Under the command of a student cadet major they seize the campus, refuse entry of the construction crews and confront the military.

15144: At the beckoning of an art dealer, eminent archaeologist Indiana Jones and his research team embark on a search for the Holy Grail. He enters a race against time to find it before the Nazis who are looking to yield its power for eternal life.
Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade

12289: A family saga covering several decades of Westward expansion in the nineteenth century—including the Gold Rush, the Civil War, and the building of the railroads.

69600: A rare look at artist and filmmaker Matthew Barney, this critically acclaimed documentary by Alison Chernick uses the filming of Drawing Restraint 9 as a backdrop to explore Barney’s creative process in both film and the art world.

780: Deep within the woods and canyons of California, four teenagers happen upon an ancient book containing the secrets of a strange, malevolent world that coexists with that of mankind. This $6,500-budget wonder from Dennis Muren is an homage to the creature features of yore.

133322: A high school senior finds herself immersed in an online game of truth of dare, where her every move starts to become manipulated by an anonymous community of “watchers”.

29226: Stories of people who regard augmenting their bodies as a way of life, whether for artistic reasons or out of pure vanity.

16777: In this dramatic courtroom thriller, Lt. Daniel Kaffee, a Navy lawyer who has never seen the inside of the courtroom, defends two stubborn Marines who have been accused of murdering a colleague.

36918: A ruthless German spy, trying to get out of Britain with vital information about D-Day, must spend time with a young woman and her crippled husband.

56235: A U.S. bomber plane’s crew is ordered to hit a heavily defended German city. Capt. Dearborn leads his men into battle while their commander and a public relations officer await the squad’s return in this film based on a real World War II mission.

36564: Shima Iwashita portrays the title character, a blind traveling musician whom is expected to remain celibate. Raped, she is expelled from her group and ultimately meets a young man who is opposed to Japanese militarism.

88497: A young boy learns to play piano in a universe of absurdity.

1082: Thirty years after Buñuel’s last work, his fellow countryman José Luis Guerín comes up with a new, acclaimed, sensual film also about “that obscure object of desire”, as a young painter arrives in Strasbourg in search of a woman who bewitched him 6 years earlier.

934: During location shooting for a jungle picture, a young actress finds herself kidnapped by natives who intend to sacrifice her to the giant ape who reigns over their tropical island.

31505: The film concerns Jozef Malesa, a Party member, and former mason, who decides, because of the ethical pressures which he feels from the obstructionism of the bureaucracy from above, to return to being a simple bricklayer.

37492: This television series happily combines a profound naturalism and a strange sense of fantasy, a liberty in its tone where hidden or manifested suffering alternates with an astonishing happiness to be alive

114034: Beneath Bruce Garrett’s under-confident, overweight exterior, the passionate heart of a salsa king lies dormant. Now, one woman is about to reignite his Latin fire.

548: Twelve-year-old overweight Anaïs lives in the shadow of her beautiful older sister, Elena. The ever observant Anaïs watches on as her sister’s innocence is stripped away when she becomes prey to a conniving Italian law student.

97079: Volume 9 in the Collection Petites Planètes—music recordings made around the world, a series on ‘experimental ethnography’ by Vincent Moon and local people created without any money involved—is an experiment with musical creation, improvising a song with Icelandic genius Helgi Jonsson in Reykjavik.

31979: Years after a plague kills most of humanity and transforms the rest into monsters, the sole survivor in New York City struggles valiantly to find a cure.

2125: Mongryong marries the beautiful Chunhyang without telling his father, the Governor of Namwon.

34699: In this classic Warner Brothers’ Looney Tunes combination of animation and live action, Porky Pig quits the cartoons to try to become a feature film star.
You Ought to Be in Pictures

156443: The great grand-niece of Napoleon commissions the sculptor Constantin Brancusi to make a sculpture of her. The result is outrageous.
A Brief History of Princess X

92281: Leos (Nikolaj Lie Kaas) comes to Stockholm to join his love Xania (Maria Bonnevie). But how can one ever be sure of love, even in the midst of it? How can one escape the insecurity and jealousy?

31461: Based on the play of the same name the film tells the story of two boys who become friends at the start of the Troubles in 1970. The boys share an obsession with Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid, with the consequence that they run away to Australia.

2041: During the first World War, on the Austro-Hungarian front, Romanian Lieutenant Apostol Bologa takes part in the hanging of a soldier of Czech origin, executed for desertion. Overcome by guilt, Bologa ends up deserting but is caught and judged.

11672: Vietnam vet John Rubin returns to New York and rents a rundown flat in Greenwhich Village. It is in this flat that he begins to film, ‘Peeping Tom’ style, the people in the apartment across the street.

96347: Using few words and gorgeous imagery, this is a poetic painting of a family, each in their own space on an August afternoon.
At the First Breath of Wind

39534: Cynical ex-RAF flyer Morgan, bored with civilian life, joins a break-in gang led by Narcy. On his first job, the getaway car crashes after killing a policeman. Morgan is framed as the driver and sent to jail. Seeking revenge, he escapes and heads for London.

24227: The crew of a starship on a year-long exploratory mission in the Alpha Centauri system discovers that the greatest dangers lie within in this engrossing adventure, arguably the high point of the space-opera tradition in Czech science fiction.

26276: Two veteran salesman dissect a sales pitch to a particular client, through their young protege.

44576: Errol Morris brings his unrivalled talents to the small screen for a stylized series of intimate interviews with a unique and fascinating array of people.

46443: Aymé’s wife recently died in an accident at the farm. He’s overcome – not by grief, but farm work: he can’t handle it alone. He absolutely must find another wife, but in his village, it’s not such an easy task.

47619: When a giant “living planet” called the Big Gete Star threatens the existence of New Namek, Goku and his friends must to spring into action and save the New Namekian home world from this invading menace.
Dragon Ball Z 6: Return of Cooler

25119: Portrays the life and career of seventeenth century painter Artemisia Gentileschi (Valentina Cervi). Breaking the boundaries of both artistic and social conventions in terms of what it was possible for a woman to do, she becomes the victim of a notorious legal battle.

18865: A bookish CIA researcher finds all his co-workers dead, and must outwit those responsible until he figures out who he can really trust.

66650: The pleasant life of middle-aged Agata — owner of the most popular bookstore in town — is turned topsy-turvy when she begins an uncertain affair with a man 13 years her junior.

27148: Small-time celebrity photographer Les Galantine has a big mouth and big dreams, but he can’t quite talk himself into the right parties to get that one great exclusive photo. He meets Toby, a homeless kid who is drawn to the bright lights of New York City and “hires” him as his assistant.

20285: Through a series of interviews and enactments we learn the story of Nico and Amalio, two children who lost a friend while climbing a mountain. Documentary and fiction seamlessly merge creating a hybrid, poetic film.

81848: Even though office assistant Thea hates her job, she’s desperate to keep it. So when her boss threatens to fire her, she comes up with a plausible excuse for staying employed: She’s pregnant. Trouble is, Thea isn’t expecting.

19643: In the future, a man struggles to keep his lunar nightclub out of the hands of the mafia.

26312: A true story of shocking violence catapults a picturesque little town into history. The close sibling relationship between the two maids takes on a new dimension as their overbearing employer (Julie Walters) discovers a sexual fever between the two sisters.

106613: The sycophantic newsreel reporter Lola Beverly wants Bugs Bunny’s life story. The great Hollywood star tells of his humble beginnings in the tenements of Manhattan.

86829: When he traces a distress signal about his grandfather’s whereabouts to an island that doesn’t seem to exist, fearless teen Sean Anderson springs into adventure mode and teams up with an unlikely ally: his stepfather.

42629: Set in contemporary Ireland, a thief who has pushed his luck, finds out that his life is in danger when all his enemies decide to team up against him.

107449: Agni, Alde, and Arian, three best friends at Fajar Harapan High School, are seen as losers, by their peers. Then Alina drops Agni for Ray, the school hunk. This makes them more eager to prove their talent.
Notes for the End of School

99317: Overnight, a complete nobody becomes a celebrity without knowing why.

21373: In a future where energy is made from fecal matter, the government rewards defecation with “juicybars”. Small-time hustlers try to get rich while fending off the mutated Diaper Gang.

41422: Mihai is in love and decides to ask Cristina out: “Hi Cristina. This is Mihai. If you don’t have a boyfriend or anything better to do would you like to go for a walk together?” An urban romance sprinkled with fantasy and the unexpected.

21217: In this evocative story told ingeniously with minimal dialogue, men and women from various backgrounds and places each deal with the loss of a loved one.

27380: Two women–a literature professor (Hanna Schygulla) and a painter (Angela Winkler)–start to rely upon their friendship as an alternative to their unhappy relationships with the men in their lives.

23246: A sad child is going to pay a visit to her mother in prison. Her solitude is immense. Sitting in the backseat, she looks on in silence outside the window while the landscape passes in front of her eyes.

1365: Rome, 1960s. Three young criminals kidnap and kill a rich proprietor. They invest the ransom money together in the heroine business. It’s the birth of a smart and ruthless organization. Meanwhile, the authorities are absorbed in a fight against national terrorism. A chilling political thriller.

95063: There’s snow on the ground and shepherds Carole and Pascal are heading through French-speaking Switzerland with three donkeys, four dogs and 800 sheep. Skirting main roads, railway tracks, suburban houses, and industrial estates, moving over fields and through forests.

12556: Jennifer Lopez stars in this gritty, emotional drama as police officer Sharon Pogue, who covers up a painful past with an anger that fuels her job performance in one of Chicago’s toughest precincts.

33963: When a jazz trumpeter is taken to the desert and a gun held to his head, we are at the beginning of a delightful fable about romance and dreams.

503: 19-year-old Tomek spies on his neighbor, Magda, through binoculars. She’s an artist in her mid-thirties, and appears to have everything – not least a constant stream of men at her beck and call. But when the two finally meet, they find they have a lot more in common than appeared at first sight…

150887: Painlevé’s first film on animal behavior, focusing on the Hermit Crab. On this film we see the Hermit Crab trying to find shelter.

35488: Test pilot Hal Jordan finds himself recruited as the newest member of the intergalactic police force, The Green Lantern Corps.

3334: Seeking shelter from a pounding rainstorm in a remote region of Wales, several travellers are admitted to a gloomy, foreboding mansion belonging to the extremely strange Femm family.

33807: Mark Romanek’s music video for Fiona Apple’s “Criminal.”

30670: When missile technology is used to enhance toy action figures, the toys soon begin to take their battle programming too seriously.

35990: When the evil wizard Gargamel chases the tiny blue Smurfs out of their village, they tumble from their magical world and into ours.

1201: In this alternately macabre and mirthful thriller, based on a true-crime story, renowned Mexican director Arturo Ripstein brings a stylish audacity to the tale of the “Lonely Hearts Killers,” a couple who, in the 1940s, posed and brother and sister to lure and murder unsuspecting widows.

93090: The video for the song was filmed in Slough during November 1981 and has the theme of the filming and editing of a murder-mystery film, featuring the band members as characters and production staff. Due to it being a “making of” video, both crew and camera apparatus appear throughout.

108452: Years after the mysterious deaths of their parents, a traumatized brother and sister find the cause of their family tragedy: a cursed mirror whose 300-year history has left a bloody trail of destruction in its wake.

467: While exploring Tierra del Fuego, the director met a stoic man clearing snow from the streets.  Haunted by his personality, he cast the man in the leading role of this strange odyssey, about a sailor who returns to his hometown after 20 years…

4231: The Most Dangerous Man in America: Daniel Ellsberg and the Pentagon Papers

36837: A thriller centered on a young woman and her autistic little brother who are trapped in a house with a ravenous tiger during a hurricane.

31786: Bill Dietrich becomes a double agent for the FBI in a Nazi spy ring.

48602: Mothra, a giant — you guessed it — moth, was a heroic force with its own movie series, and this film pits the flying insect against our scaly friend with killer halitosis.

55111: Jeff Grant is an ‘all-American high school student applying to the Air Force Academy. During a routine background check, FBI agent Roy Parmenter uncovers evidence that makes them both suspect Jeff’s parents are Soviet spies.

28037: Sardonic detective Shane, thrown out of one town for bringing trouble, heads for home and his ex-partner’s detective agency. The business is in a sad way, and Shane, who has had the forethought to provide himself with a 250-dollar commission from an old lady on the train, is welcomed with open arms.

35724: “The story of Carl Brashear, the first African American, then also the first amputee, US Navy Diver and the man who trained him.”

57024: Minor-league television celebrity John Leary leads a peripetic existence with his two sons, moving from one station to another, eventually landing at a Podunk station as a late-night creature-feature host.

93258: The film takes place in a cafe where various human types and characters sit at tables. They chat about different things via an animated ‘language’ of artistic symbols and pictures.

116382: A Japanophile young Belgian woman in Tokyo falls into a whirlwind romance with a Francophile Japanese student, in this charming and tender tale of young love and cultural discovery.

110215: Three interlocking love stories involving three couples in three cities: Rome, Paris, and New York.

43438: Tania is a shy, hardworking young girl who works in a convention center. When she meets Leila, she is fascinated by this eccentric and unusual girl.

86862: This sci-fi action thriller tracks the adventures of a group of young Americans touring Moscow who get caught up in an alien invasion. Despite the unfamiliarity of their surroundings, the Yanks quickly team up with the Russians to fight back.

127611: An in-depth look at daily life at one of the most famous cultural institutions in the world, The Kunsthistorisches Museum in Vienna.

104609: Among the endless stories that can get two people together, Miele offers a soft yet shocking one. Irene helps the terminally ill die in a quick and peaceful way. She looks like an uneasy angel by the deathbeds, but she is also assured that she’s doing an honorable thing.

23369: Astronomer Carl Sagan leads us on an engaging guided tour of the various elements and cosmological theories of the Universe.

20006: A group of white high school teens become involved with Harlem’s black hip-hop crowd.

86906: While driving through mexico, Goofy accidentally outsmarts a bull in the middle of the road. The villagers then decide that he would make the perfect matador.

26191: Deep in the heart of the Appalachian Mountains in West Virginia, where every man owns a gun and a moonshine still, abides living legend Jesco White, “the dancing outlaw”. After his father’s death, crazy Jesco dons his father’s tap shoes and takes his show on the road.

44691: A romp about a hapless crook who gets more than he’s bargained for when he kidnaps a brat with an insatiable appetite for sweets. Unable to keep him under control, the kidnapper returns him to his father, who refuses to take him back.

87720: Based on Theodore Dreiser’s 1925 novel An American Tragedy, which itself alludes to the real life 1906 murder of Grace Brown allegedly by Chester Gillette.

22057: In the port city of Icheon, five female friends struggle to stay close while forging a life for themselves after high school. When one of the group moves to Seoul, the other girls deal with the loss in different ways.

118224: Follows fame-obsessed teens who unwittingly become stars of the next internet sensation.

25036: A drag queen comes to the rescue of a man who, after inheriting his father’s shoe factory, needs to diversify his product if he wants to keep the business afloat.

100507: Trainer Oronzo Canà is called to manage Longobarda, the team of a small town of Northern Italy, when it’s promoted to the First Division.

25152: An English girl and an Indian elephant, born on the same day, share a common destiny.
