39960: The film tells the story of the assassination of King Yazdgerd who runs away to Merv and takes refuge there anonymously in a mill. The miller, his wife and his daughter all express a different version of the story.

27004: Lucky Jackson arrives in town with his car literally in tow ready for the first Las Vegas Grand Prix – once he has the money to buy an engine. He gets the cash easily enough but mislays it when the pretty swimming pool manageress takes his mind off things.

25055: A romance based around the reunion of four college friends and lovers after ten years.

47755: Just about to have a baby, Marie is suddenly abandoned by her boyfriend, who leaves her for another woman. Marie refuses to be a victim and finds comfort at work, in an arthouse theater specialized in American classic movies.

27160: On his sprawling country estate, an aging writer matches wits with the struggling actor who has stolen his wife’s heart.

25131: King Kong battles Godzilla in Japan

39478: Shady lady in the tropics Dorothy Mackaill strikes matches on her thumbnail and flames in the pants of as sleazy and sinister a bunch as ever crawled out of the woodwork.

44796: In this wild explosion of youthful energy, a young man who cannot fit into the rigid communist system sees his fortunes changed after a series of robberies, and becomes a high-stakes crime boss.
Young and Healthy As a Rose

107979: Sam Von Schamm The Hessian and Bugs Bunny fight it out in the little known American Revolutionary War Battle of Bagel Heights.

105554: Several young women are having a friendly pillow fight in a dormitory room. Just as the battle gets particularly lively, a teacher enters and breaks it up.

42765: When Emma meets Cassandra, they initiate a relationship filled with physical and psychological challenges. Emma does whatever it takes to master the rules of the game. Lines are crossed and the stakes get higher and higher.

32992: The Bowery is a neighborhood in New York City populated largely by the down and out or transients. New to the neighborhood is Ray, who is one of those who can and still does work, but like the others spends what little money he has on booze, which means he usually sleeps on the streets.

36428: Low-life Harry falls in love with sweet Betty who inspires him to improve himself so he can marry her. He enters a $25,000 cross-country hiking contest. After many adventures he wins, pays off his father Amos’s mortgage and marries Betty.

151876: In the late 70s and early 80s, Los Sures was one of the poorest neighbourhoods in New York City. Diego Echeverria’s film skillfully represents the challenges of its time: drugs, gang violence, crime; while also giving a portrait of the vitality of this Puerto Rican and Dominican community.

36854: An unimpressive, every-day man is forced into a situation where he is told to kill a politician to save his kidnapped daughter.

97299: A documentary about bizarre residents of Shutka, a Macedonian village built on the former city dump area.

113119: Waking up the morning after hosting a party, a man discovers a stranger passed out on his floor. He spends the rest of the day trying to convince her to leave.

4252: The story of the marriage of England’s King Arthur to Guinevere is played out amid the pageantry of Camelot.

31681: NYC marketing executive Neal Page has only one ambition: to get to Chicago to be with his wife and kids for Thanksgiving. Unfortunately, he finds himself stuck in Wichita, Kansas with a blabbering shower curtain ring salesman named Del Griffith…

34961: A group of friends travel to a cabin in the Norwegian forest. It’s a rumour that at night a crazy man can be heard screaming at a lake nearby the cabin.

48705: A mischievous French schoolgirl named Madeline tries to save her boarding school from the real estate market, but finds it difficult to convince the building’s owner not to sell. Based on the popular children’s books by Ludwig Bemelmans.

35747: Based on the alleged autobiography of gay Peruvian talk show host Jaime Bailey. Joaquin, a young man from the high class of Lima, deals with problems concerning his sexual identity as a child, then as a teenager pressured by his macho snobbish father.

28054: In the third—and arguably greatest—of Lumet’s five collaborations with Sean Connery, the actor gives a revelatory performance as a burned-out British detective on a task force searching for an accused child molester.

36930: A gentle and wise grey spider with a flair for promotion pledges to save a young pig from slaughter for dinner food.

3357: When a couple of lazy hunter-gatherers (Jack Black and Michael Cera) are banished from their primitive village, they set off on an epic journey through the ancient world in Columbia Pictures’ comedy Year One.

560: Larisa Shepitko’s stunning first feature after graduating from the All-Russian State Institute for Cinematography was this fascinating character study about a once heroic female Russian fighter pilot now living a quiet, disappointingly ordinary life as a school principal.

33900: The small town of Haven becomes a hot-bed of inventions all run by a strange green power device. The whole town is digging something up in the woods, and only an alcoholic poet can discover the secret of the Tommyknockers.

30777: When his brother disappears, Robert Manning pays a visit to the remote country house he was last heard from.

108929: A dark drama centered on a group of teens with a penchant for finding trouble.

1306: A modest family is destined for tragedy due to the rivalry between two teenage stepsisters. It begins when Tao Lan accidentally kills her stepsister. Seventeen years later, a female guard escorts the solitary Tao Lan, now a stranger to life outside prison, to her first painful family reunion…

132398: The friendship between two life-long girlfriends is put to the test when one starts a family and the other falls ill.

33418: In the basement of the National Library in Madrid two civil servants show us some of the canvases that won the National Painting Award between 1941 and 1969.

404: Roman Polanski’s controversial English-language debut stars Catherine Deneuve as Carol, a beautiful, frigid young woman whose grasp on reality begins to crumble when she’s left alone in her sister’s London flat.

2069: In this landmark documentary, Kenzo Okuzaki, a veteran of Japan’s WWII campaign in New Guinea, painstakingly tracks down the former military officers responsible for the strange deaths of several of his fellow soldiers.
The Emperor's Naked Army Marches On

31835: Ellen (Jeanne Balibar) must come to terms with a new turn in her life. Although her job as a flight attendant keeps her circling the globe, she feels her private life has become a kind of placebo, giving her the sense of security she needs so badly.

114178: U.K. gay activists work to help miners during their lengthy strike of the National Union of Mineworkers in the summer of 1984.

50142: Recently dumped Amanda moves into a new apartment — one with a bird’s-eye view of stud-muffin Jim’s digs across the way. Can Amanda and Jim’s attraction survive the doubt Amanda harbors that the object of her affection may be… a murderer?

32642: After an airplane is forced to crash-land in a remote area, its passengers find themselves face-to-face with an alien force that wants to possess them body and soul—and perhaps take over the entire human race.

3233: Chief Niemans is investigating a series of ritual murders: The victims are crucified. He teams up with young officer Reda, who gets embroiled after a man dressed as a monk tries to kill a confused guy Reda picked up on the street.
Crimson Rivers 2: Angels of the Apocalypse

1262: Overworked coffee shop waitress Bella isn’t looking forward to her 35th birthday. She takes a chance on womanizer Bruno. Bella and her friends battle romance’s bittersweet difficulties. Bella discovers fairy tales can come true, even in New York City. A comedy from Amos Kollek.

88677: Leader of a traveling gypsy band from the steppes of Bessarabia (now Moldova), Toma Alistar is a skilled violinist whose fame takes him on tours around European capitals and royal courts. He remains obsessed with his first love, beautiful Leanca who was married elsewhere while Toma was traveling.

52113: Burt Gummer returns home to Perfection, Nev., to find that the town of terror has become a theme park, and when the simulated giant worm attacks turn real, the survivalist must battle the creatures once again.

33864: Zephyr, a strong-willed girl, spends her summer vacation with her grandparents in the mountains, waiting for her mother to come and take her back home. Her mother finally shows up, but only to say farewell before going far away places for a voluntary position.

878: Deceased playboy Henry Van Cleve presents himself to the outer offices of Hades, where he asks a bemused Satan for permission to enter the gates of hell. Henry proceeds to recount a lifetime of wooing and pursuing women, his long, happy marriage to Martha notwithstanding.

31449: The last piece of the trilogy, following Katatsumori and Seen the Heaven, filming her grandma and herself. Her gazes and insights are cast on the lovable beings in front of her eyes.

104621: Tahar Rahim stars as a young man compulsively attracted to danger.  He becomes a subcontractor at a French nuclear facility, where he is exposed to deadly radiation levels.  He is transformed by his passionate and forbidden affair with a woman he meets at the plant.

23341: This satrical film uses visuals of Dakar’s architecture and two offscreen narrators, one French, the other Senegalese, to illustrate the blend of colonial and native influences mixing within the city.

21310: Katie is just a regular woman, working in a factory and struggling to take care of her young daughter. When she meets Paco, just a regular man, they fall in love. Their love results in yet another miracle: an extraordinary baby named Ricky. Based on the story Moth, by Rose Tremain.

87708: Short film showing the artist falling off a chair on the roof of his house and rolling down its slope to the ground.

120490: The director follows a Sunni Arab doctor as he prepares to run for the early 2005 elections in Iraq.

21274: Dinner is the most calm, serene moment of the day, when defenses are down and the essential aspects of a human being come forth complete with vices and virtues, when desires, martyrdom and love are admitted to.

44515: To win a reporting job, a young man must spend the night in a haunted house.

23189: Crainquebille is the name of a fruit and vegetable peddler who, accused of having insulted a policeman, becomes trapped in the bureaucratic web of French justice.

103724: The latest stand-up show from Cem Yilmaz.

39557: A high-school gym teacher has big plans for the summer, but is forced to cancel them to teach a “bonehead” English class for misfit goof-off students. Fortunately, his unconventional brand of teaching fun field trips begins to connect with them, and even inspires ardor in some.

26371: “Conner bases his film on government footage of the first underwater A-bomb test, July 25, 1946, at Bikini Atoll in the Pacific.

65844: Before he had a playhouse for kids, Pee-Wee Herman was entertaining adults inside the famed Roxy Theatre on Sunset Strip, with an act — filmed as part of HBO’s “On Location” series — that paid homage to children’s television shows of the 1950s.

19620: In the very near future, Adam is having a serious identity crisis. An evil corporation illegally cloned him, and now they’re trying to hide the evidence. Torn from his family and faced with a duplicate of himself, Adam races against time to reclaim his life and stop the underground cloning movement.

8042: A crazed scientist invents an invisibility formula. He plans to use the formula to create an army of invisible zombies.

38669: A romantic rivalry among members of a secret society becomes even tenser when one of the men is assigned to carry out an assassination.

2146: The loose-hinged plot concerns four bachelors who go on holiday in the forest; each man undergoes profound character developments and transformations. Also figuring in the proceedings is a group of humble forest dwellers, who prove not to be the rubes the bachelors assume them to be.
Days and Nights in the Forest

149206: One morning, a television set broke down in a living room in Gary, Indiana, leaving a large family of children with nothing to do—so they started singing. Soon the family was singing at talent shows and winning trophies.
Michael Jackson's Journey from Motown to Off the Wall

31566: Each day of the week is represented by a ballerina, beginning with a young child and ending with an older ballet teacher.

957: Broadway actress Myrtle Gordon (Gena Rowlands) rehearses for her latest play, about a woman unable to admit that she is aging. When she witnesses the accidental death of an adoring young fan, she begins to confront the turmoil she faces in her own life.

2022: A caustic and tragic tale of drug use in a haunting version of future America where a new drug causes loss of identity. Live-action photography overlaid with rotoscoping is used to re-create sci-fi author Philip K. Dick’s own experiences.

12866: Matsuzaki is a playwright in 1926 Tokyo supported by a wealthy patron.  One evening, Matsuzaki crosses paths with a beautiful and mysterious woman, leading to an odyssey of infidelity and obsession…

53302: Jack Casey is a stock market dynamo — until one day when he makes a decision that completely destroys his professional prospects. His next gig? He becomes a New York City bike messenger and soon falls for a colleague, Terri.

31402: When Miron’s beloved wife Tanya passes away, he asks his best friend Aist to help him say goodbye according to the rituals of the Merya culture, an ancient Finno-Ugric tribe from Lake Nero. The two men set out on a road trip thousands of miles across the boundless lands.

108806: FUBAR and Goon director Michael Dowse makes a surprising swerve into sweetness with this winning romantic comedy starring Daniel Radcliffe and Zoe Kazan.

37595: As a visual narrative it is reminiscent of a pile of postcards from a journey, which indeed is what the film is.

30658: Created limb by limb and programmed to kill, a deadly automaton questions her maker. New stop-motion animation from the award-winning Quay Brothers.

1229: Father and son live together in a rooftop apartment. They have lived alone for years in their own private world, full of memories and daily rituals.

36463: Three episodes: A dollmaker whose dolls are eerily human, a tale of necrophilia, and a doctor proves love is dead.
The Strange World of Coffin Joe

95283: It is six years into a future American civil war. A man has created a drug that enhances fighting skills. But will he give it to the theocratic government, or the rebels? A Cronenberg-directed television curio from the early seventies.

55139: “Saturday Night Live” character Stuart Smalley finds his positive thinking isn’t working. After losing his TV show, a depressed Smalley pulls himself together when he realizes that nobody needs his help more than his own dysfunctional family.

111103: In this Marvel Comic adaption, four astronauts get bombarded with cosmic rays when an accident occurs. The four of them acquire special powers, and decide to form a superhero group called the Fantastic Four. They then fight their arch-enemy Dr. Doom.

6248: Paul Newman plays a jaded disc-jockey who offers his services to WUSA, a right-wing hate station broadcasting from New Orleans. While struggling with his own apathy, he starts spreading hateful messages perpetrated by Pat Hingle, a power-mad master of WUSA.

4219: Set during a turbulent period in 1970-80s Italy, the plot centres on passionate couple Sergio and Susanna, who have been living as fugitives.

29321: A middle-aged couple, on the verge of proceeding with a divorce, find themselves questioning their decision to separate when fellow friends and neighbors, oblivious to their marital troubles, assemble at their house for a 4th of July Weekend party.

16670: A teacher opens a time capsule that has been dug up at his son’s elementary school; in it are some chilling predictions — some that have already occurred and others that are about to — that lead him to believe his family plays a role in the events that are about to unfold.

96088: Comic tale of a cynical TV star’s slow-combustion romance with a young paraplegic. The host of a reality show that trades in human misery gets attacked on air and meets his new lover while losing his other friends and his popularity.

35668: A love story between a girl and a trombone player.

34432: Skin, eyes, knees, horses, hair, sun, earth. Old song of Mexican hero, Valentin, sung by blind Jose Santollo Nadiso en Santa Cruz de la Soledad.

30490: A science-fiction drama about the landing of a meteor-like object in the desert.

109894: Newly restored by the Academy Film Archive, David Rimmer’s 1970 avant-garde classic takes a single film fragment of a factory worker unraveling a sheet of cellophane, and alters it through a mesmerizing series of spectral apparitions and alchemical and sonic permutations.

687: The true story of the death of Italy’s most wanted criminal and celebrated hero, Francesco Rosi’s groundbreaking political film is a startling exposé of Sicily and the tangled relations between its citizens, the Mafia, and government officials.

91221: A young girls’ sexual awakening swelters in the heat on a long summer day as she casts her attention to the couple next door.

3291: A woman snoops through her boyfriend’s palm pilot and reveals his former girlfriends, which causes her to question why they’re still listed in his little black book.

29064: A mid-life crisis plagued man and his friends find renewal and purpose on a cattle driving vacation.

36726: In a drought-stricken southern region of the country, a small boy sets out in search of his missing parents.

111246: It begins with Perry as an old woman living in a modernistic home with her husband. It is hinted that the two are in a loveless marriage as Perry makes herself a cup of coffee and goes up to her bedroom.

93051: A love story has come to its end. When a man steps into the room where his beloved one lives, she tells him to go and that she doesn’t want to see him anymore. He realizes that this is going to be their last meeting – the epilogue.

113373: A dreamy, ironic comedy about a generation of hedonistic students in the 1990s. Their favourite activity: talking endlessly. During a series of vacation days filled with sun-drenched naps, squabbling, waterskiing competitions and love-making, the actors discuss their concerns in dry dialogues.

32784: A federal investigator tracks down a gold digging woman who moves from husband to husband, kills them and collects the inheritance.

16451: Allie’s new roommate is about to borrow a few things without asking. Her clothes. Her boyfriend. Her life.

29100: Deservedly regarded as one of Georges Méliès’ supreme masterpieces, The Man with the Rubber Head represented one of his most significant technical advances.
The Man with the Rubber Head

35835: Various factions including a Mexican Bandit, a gang of Homosexual Cowboys and a Priest feud over stolen gold in a surreal town.
Django Kill... If You Live, Shoot!

37418: The introduction of the first television set into a small village sparks social confrontation and a lot of laughs in this popular comedy that spawned a number of sequels.

12597: Despite the fact that he is low man on the totem pole in his tribe of fearless hunters, a brave young boy (Steven Strait) longs to win the heart of a beautiful princess (Camilla Belle) who is well above his station in life.

36642: A frustrated young mother turns to a fundamentalist community for answers, but after years of dogma and loss, she must find the courage to ask the questions that will help her reclaim her life.

1008: Enigmatic Mamoru lives alone with his poisonous, hauntingly luminous jellyfish. When he is arrested for murdering his boss, a young co-worker who is fascinated and influenced by Mamoru starts caring for his jellyfish and befriends his father with an aim to become his surrogate son.

134101: She is the most ginger, myopic, touchy-feely, lying, truthful, confusing, obstinate and the most fearsome of heroines. The lady in the car has never seen the ocean, she’s running away from the police and she keeps saying to herself that she’s not insane and yet …
The Lady in the Car with Glasses and a Gun

31623: An extremely lovely tribute to Yasujiro Ozu, on the 20th anniversary of his death, by critics, actors, and collaborators.

36992: Harriet M. Welsch is a spy. But when Harriet’s friends find her secret notebook the tables are turned on her. Can she win her friends back and still keep on going with the spy buisness?

2203: A New York tramp (Al Jolson) falls in love with the mayor’s amnesiac girlfriend after rescuing her from a suicide attempt.

32428: A sweet-and-sour illustration of war perceived as an absurd game between adults.

3059: Relationship filled with pitfalls between a pleasant female video producer and a gallery owner as they become embroiled in their self-spun web of illusions. Bitter-sweet serenade to modern courtship.
Virgin Stripped Bare by Her Bachelors

30805: Donna is a young woman from meager beginnings, who has high hopes for the future and dreams of living the glamorous life as a first class international flight attendant. She is willing to do whatever it takes to ensure that her dreams come true.

96105: Finding out that her father, Captain Longstocking, has been captured by pirates, Pippi and friends embark on an action packed voyage to rescue him.
Pippi Longstocking on the Seven Seas

31747: Anne Boleyn is a doe-eyed vixen who is ordered by her power-hungry uncle to bewitch King Henry VIII. Her shy sister Mary has always been in Anne’s shadow. Anne is prettier, more accomplished, and desired by many men. So when the King picks Mary as his mistress, Anne turns on her sister.

35681: A man occupies a position of trust with a merchant in an East Asian port. He’s sacked when he’s caught stealing, but he pretends to commit suicide and a captain he befriended agrees to take him to a secret trading post.

13979: In 1955, Orson Welles directed and hosted a mini series for British television. He leads us through a few famous places of Europe with his inimitable touch. Between a home movie and a cinematic essay, these short films have been described by French critics as the missing link in Welles’ work.
Around the World With Orson Welles

2367: At a legendary Parisian nightclub at the end of the 19th Century, a British poet dives headfirst into a passionate love affair with the club’s biggest star, a beautiful, tragic courtesan named Satine.

33716: International terrorists attempt to kidnap a wealthy couples child. Their plan comes unstuck when, a deadly Black Mamba sent by mistake instead of a harmless snake, escapes, and the terrorists and several hostages are trapped in the boy’s London home.

51016: After another deadly shark attack, Ellen Brody decides she has had enough of New England’s Amity Island and moves to the Caribbean to join her son, Michael, and his family. But a great white shark has followed her there, hungry for more lives.

9039: Rocky struggles in family life after his bout with Apollo Creed, while the embarrassed champ insistently goads him to accept a challenge for a rematch.

22096: Director Obie Benz and writer Pierce Rafferty spent years combining archival footage and interviews relating some of their earliest sexual experiences, to create this look at the sexual attitudes pervading American society in the mid-20th Century.

47827: The intimate portrait of a young man struggling to find his footing in life while coping with a physical disability and trying to live up to his father’s expectations. A trail of lies slowly catches up with him as he tries to become Romeo Eleven.

123672: A girl is mysteriously killed after recording herself playing with an ancient Ouija Board, which leads to a close group of friends to investigate this board. They later find out that some things aren’t meant to be played with, especially the ‘other side’.

26150: In this interesting drama, three sequences which could have formed separate stories are linked together, like cars on a train, to give a larger perspective on the nature of reality and film. Secvente (Sequences, reffering to film sequences) is Alexandru Tatos’ quintessential film.

126992: Sawa Yamagishi worked as a nursing-care helper. The family for an old man asked Sawa to sleep with him, which led her to lose her job. Now, she has nowhere to go. Sawa finds elderly people in trouble and gets involved in their lives. Meeting them, Sawa’s own wounds start to heal.

101928: Pirate Yosemite Sam chases Bugs all over the ship to find out where the buried treasure is.

105492: A documentary on the history of the slasher film.
Going to Pieces: The Rise and Fall of the Slasher Film

38950: A remake of the silent movie of the same name starring Rodolfo Valentino. Compared with the grandiloquence of Ingram, Minnelli’s is a refined melodrama where the story of two cousins divided by war and very different education takes a back seat to the romantic tangle.

101554: A visual art work that borrows the principles of fugue from music. A man, his dreams, a hotel room…

43755: A lawyer conducts business from the back of his Lincoln town car while representing a high-profile client in Beverly Hills.

26398: A man dates one of his female employees and invites her to his apartment. She will soon discover what he has in mind…

87955: Bugs is tricked into being the first rabbit shot into space. When he lands on the moon, he finds Commander X-2 set to blow up planet Earth.

47693: A guy tries to patch things up with his soon-to-be-married pal after botching things up at his bachelor party. Based on Tucker Max’s best-seller “I Hope They Serve Beer in Hell”.
I Hope They Serve Beer in Hell

87529: An 1896 British short silent actuality film featuring twin girls squabbling over a piece of cake at a tea party, which was one of the very first ‘facials’ and one of the most popular items exhibited at the Alhambra Theatre in 1896.

23004: AIDS, drug abuse, police brutality, and other social ills in post-Soviet Russia.

43631: In this western-like docufiction, the inhabitants of a trailer park play themselves. Fred and his friends are involved in dubious affairs: stealing expensive cars. Then a white stray dog brings about a complete change in Fred’s life. His surroundings have trouble understanding.

23160: Tells the story of a suicidal, young man and his stay in a Dublin psychiatric hospital where he meets new friends who greatly impact his life.

118149: What is taking Deborah Logan? Some memories are worth forgetting.

70170: A former actress clashes with her wealthy and spoiled stepdaughter over their inheritance after the death of their protector.

92088: In one of Tulio’s most brutal melodramas, Maija, an innocent country girl, is seduced, abandoned, and driven to prostitution. Tulio explores society’s double-standard while condemning the patriarchy’s perception of feminine sexuality.

151587: An inexperienced college student meets a wealthy businessman whose sexual practices put a strain on their relationship.

30432: Two men in their twenties spend their time in Parisian cafes trying to pick up women. They take one girl dancing, and then steal her purse when she prefers to dance with another man.

1043: Nouadhibou is a small seaside village on the Mauritanian coast. Amongst its white-washed buildings and melodic songs passed down through generations, lives intertwine while waiting for a hypothetical happiness…

3012: An old traditional family and a modern family battle over land in a small English village and almost destroy each other.

97314: Lu Jie has no idea her husband Yongzhao is leading a double life, until the day she sees him entering a hotel with a young woman. Her world crumbles – and it’s just the beginning.

33639: When a regular guy dumps a superhero of her neediness, she uses her powers to make his life a living hell.

1127: A doctor’s wife is terrorised by a strange plumber who is working in her house…

30556: Six friends dig up a corpse named Orville. They use it in a satanic ritual to make the dead rise from their graves.
Children Shouldn't Play with Dead Things

109952: A teacher who uses the Beatles songs to teach English in the Spain of 1966 hears that John Lennon is in Almería shooting a film. Deciding to meet him, he sets out on the journey.
Living Is Easy with Eyes Closed

34490: Cattleman Flint cuts off farmer Sims’ water supply. When Sims’ son Ted goes for water, one of Flint’s men kills him. Cheyenne is sent to finish off Sims, but finding the family at the newly dug grave, he changes sides.

741: Renowned oceanographer Steve Zissou has sworn vengeance on the mysterious Jaguar shark that devoured a member of his crew. His regular crew, Team Zissou, is joined by various oddballs as they set sail on the high-seas. Their mission is challenged by pirates and figures from Zissou’s past.
The Life Aquatic with Steve Zissou

32507: Documentary tracing the origins and downfall of Mozambique’s revolutionary Marxist cinema.
Kuxa Kanema: The Birth of Cinema

108774: Set in pre-First World War Germany, Patrice Leconte’s venture into English-language filmmaking chronicles the simmering love triangle between an ailing factory owner (Alan Rickman), his young bride (Rebecca Hall) and his protégé (Richard Madden).

3176: When the Emperor senses a looming threat, he relocates his family from the Palace. While they are en route, mysterious assassins attack them. His family’s return sets off a tumultuous sequence of dark surprises. Amid the glamour and grandeur of royalty, ugly secrets are revealed.

2080: At the turn of the twentieth century, three Australian officers are court-martialed for alleged war crimes. With no time to prepare, an Australian major, appointed as defense attorney, must prove that they were just following orders and are being turned into political pawns.

4117: In the central tale, a Japanese man wakes up alone in a brightly illuminated white room with no windows or doors. When he presses a mysteriously phallic protuberance that appears on one wall, a pink toothbrush materializes from nowhere.

6146: A fifteen year marriage dissolves, leaving both the husband and wife, and their four children, devastated.

4073: In 11th Century Scandinavia, One Eye, a warrior of strength is caged up like an animal. He has a single alliance, with the boy slave that feeds him. They manage to escape during a mutiny but the challenges along their journey prove to be a harbinger of what lies ahead.

35402: After the death of her husband, Lilia’s life revolves solely around her teenage daughter, Salma. Whilst looking for Salma late one night, Lilia stumbles upon a belly dance cabaret and though initially reserved and taken aback by the culture of the place, Lilia gets consistently drawn back to it.

589: Playwright and novelist Yukio Mishima foreshadowed his own violent suicide with this ravishing short feature, which depicts the seppuku of a army officer.

36609: The king of Dutch deadpan Alex van Warmerdam strikes again with the delightfully off-kilter Ober (Waiter), in which a fictional waiter goes to complain about his miserable existence to his creator.

48440: The new generation in a family of cops, homicide detective Tom Hardy is demoted when he makes public his suspicions that a serial killer is a fellow officer. But the murders get personal when the victims they begin finding are his ex-lovers.

6022: A meditation on power and the metaphor of the body of state, based on the real episode of dementia experienced by George III.

125566: A story about masculinity in women’s perspective. Ning & Martha are a couple of prostitute which living in different classes until they are meet Erik; a guy whose having a hidden purpose.

27189: A man defies warnings from his friend and prepares to spend the light in a haunted castle.
The Haunted Castle | The Devil's Castle

107724: An isolated community near the Latvia-Russia border. A space of ambiguity, a psycho-geography, an absence of personal histories.

24382: The business partnership of two prostitutes in Amsterdams’s Red Light District slowly comes to an end when they seek out matrimonial stability and realize that sometimes business and pleasure don’t mix.

42938: The film travels in close-up over the mysterious terrains of nude human bodies as they touch and explore one another. It is like an expedition into human geography, an intimate sculpture, an erogenous healing ceremony, and an ode to the pleasures of touch.

98344: “Blue Orchid” is the first track by the American alternative rock band The White Stripes from their album Get Behind Me Satan, and the first single to be released from the album.

20320: The wealthy Domenico has had a long love affair with Filumena, who he’s been happy to keep as a mistress but nothing more. The problem comes when she grows tired of being kept to the side and hatches a plan to become a bigger part of his life…

8184: An ideal housewife begins to suspect her loving adolescent daughter may be a heartless killer.

87406: Buenos Aires at the end of summer. Marina, Sofia and Violeta are alone in the family home after their grandmother, who had brought them up, has died. They have to come to terms with her death, each in her own way.

39659: An original kind of tribute’ is what George Mackay Brown called Tait’s 1964 documentary about one of Scotland’s greatest poets; Hugh MacDiarmid.

25310: Legal and illegal criminality. An American tourist with a boat is robbed by a gang of teenager boys, assisted by the leader’s sister. But soon afterward she jumps to the victim’s boat to escape her brother’s incestuous jealousy.

38403: When a disheartened attorney moonlighting as a high school wrestling coach stumbles across a star athlete, things seem to be looking up. That is, until the boy’s mother shows up fresh from rehab and flat broke, threatening to derail everything.

23287: Mimmi is a very lonely girl, not knowing what to do with her life. On the search for friends and boyfriends, she wanders around alone in different cities.

41587: In 1925 Romania a cosmopolitan family is reassigned to a brutally bleak and dangerous outpost on the Bulgarian/Romanian frontier where both their relationship and humanity are severely tested.

64874: In this sequel to the 1973 sexploitation classic Sex & Fury, Ocho is back, this time plotting her escape from a violent drug cartel that dared capture the deadly vixen. But once she’s free, Ocho still has to contend with a group of Yakuzas.
Female Yakuza Tale: Inquisition and Torture

38567: Jordan’s imagery is exquisite and eloquent, concentrating on simple, repeated use of particularly poetic symbols and figures, a conglomerative effect of old Gustave Dore drawings, 19th century whatnot memorabilia, all fused to a totally aware perception.

25274: In a totalitarian society of the future, in which the government controls all facets of the media, a homicide detective investigates a string of bombings, and finds out more than he bargained for.

47574: The Haunted World of El Superbeasto

47908: The story of a turkish poor family who tries to emigrate illegaly to Switzerland.

45525: Episodic comedy drama about two recruits who join Italy’s carabinieri, become friends and work together on several cases.

27225: After they’re framed for a crime they didn’t commit, a group of Iraq War veterans breaks free and looks to clear their name.

58236: Cody, Anita, Eileen and Lilly are four tough Wild West women on the run from the law. To make matters worse, as they’re withdrawing cash from a Texas bank, bank robber Kid Jarrett takes it.

5: Pedro smuggles himself into New York to reunite with his long-lost father. Upon arrival he’s robbed of his identity by an impostor who seeks to steal his father’s fortune. Thus begins Pedro’s exciting and terrifying journey to find his father before the disaster strikes.

107488: The documentary consists of tape of Don’s show (never been filmed before), interviews with Don’s contemporaries, (Steve Lawrence, Bob Newhart, Debbie Reynolds, etc.), established comedians (Billy Crystal, Rosanna Barr, Robin Williams, Chris Rock, etc.) and young comedians.
Mr. Warmth: The Don Rickles Project

27779: We sit and observe a group of children watching television. What they are watching is not known, but the expressions on their faces speak volumes.

100219: The film is a series of images, shown in short takes (anywhere from a few frames to 30 seconds), of more or less fetishistic imagery (something Bouyxou was particularly fond of).

26523: Inspector Tellini investigates serial crimes where victims are paralyzed while having their bellies ripped open with a sharp knife, much in the same way tarantulas are killed by the black wasp.

24572: “Go! Go! Go!” condenses two years of patient documentary filmmaking into a delirious and exhilarating vision of a hyperactive city.

103012: Winter, 1915. Confined by her family to an asylum in the South of France – where she will never sculpt again – the chronicle of Camille Claudel’s reclusive life, as she waits for a visit from her brother, Paul Claudel.

47028: Avant-garde parable of war with small boys fighting over and killing a goat on a beach.

26447: More auditions for Guy Maddin’s Cowards Bend the Knee.

44347: Donald is responsible for making sure his nephews get to school when they attempt to play hookey.

8774: Passengers on a ship traveling from Mexico to Europe in the 1930s represent society at large in that era. The crew is German, including the ship’s doctor who falls in love with one of the passengers, La Contessa.

22581: A teenaged girl is executed for going against a king’s wishes and honoring her brother’s death.

24416: The story of a young woman’s descent into the kinky and dangerous sexual underground in Madrid.

23477: In Dumala’s shadowy world we find darkness, emptiness, and loneliness; alienated individuals fragmented from the world at large, unable to articulate the range of emotions that quiver uncomfortably within them.

21426: When her ex-husband sues for custody of her child, a white divorcée argues that a mixed household is an improper place to raise the girl, the new husband fights for his parental rights in court, fighting against a judge who represents the prejudices of the era.

119760: Arlo, a 70-foot-tall teenage Apatosaurus, befriends a young human boy named Spot.

22749: In the Russian countryside, a family lives next to a railroad track. A boy remembers when he and his parents had a cow, living off its milk and using it as a beast of burden.

25484: After a successful bank robbery, Micky hopes to take back his girlfriend Mary who has been taken from him. On the way to Paris he meets Leon, a neurotic dreamer whom he considers an idiot. Leon can hardly understand what Micky is up to but he follows him everywhere and soon falls in love with Mary.

47384: All practical creature and effects heavy horror movie about a group of people trapped in a house falling prey to a Wizard and the creatures he summons.

104073: Story of two young people who belong to different worlds. It is the chronicle of a love improbable, almost impossible but inevitable dragging in a frantic journey they discover the first great love.

42018: A Disney animated version of “Treasure Island”. The only difference is that the film is set in outer space with alien worlds and other galactic wonders.

20718: After the death of his mother, fortysomething introvert Mathieu enters into a second relationship with his high-school girlfriend, Maya.

21542: A psychological horror about a lonely young woman traumatized by a difficult childhood, and her increasingly desperate attempts to connect with the people around her…

112842: 16 year old Billie’s reluctant path to independence is accelerated when her mother reveals plans to gender transition and their time together becomes limited to Tuesday afternoons.

7724: Jeffrey Hunter is cast as Jesus Christ, delivering a wholly credible performance in this most taxing of roles in this Nicholas Ray film.

31098: A psychotherapist examines a patient who believes he’s the world’s greatest lover. Starring Marlon Brando, Johnny Depp and Faye Dunaway.

54455: In writer-director Ron Shelton’s action-comedy, two cops with ambitions beyond police work get sucked into the case of a lifetime. Det. Joe Gavilian makes extra money in real estate, and his partner, K.C. Calden, teaches yoga and dreams of acting.

111635: When Nasty Canasta cheats Bugs out of his gold, the rabbit retaliates by playing a naive hayseed whose effortless and unrelenting winning bankrupts Canasta’s new casino.

113664: Never turn the hands and never get mad. And certainly don’t fall in love. Flouting these rules could mean death for little Jack: he was born on the coldest day that Scotland has ever known and because his heart froze to ice on that fateful night, the midwife quickly replaced it with a cuckoo clock.

32293: Two middle-aged women move to Hollywood, California after their sons are convicted of a notorious murder and open a dance school for children eager to tap their way to stardom.

34304: Patrick Bateman is dead, but his evil legacy continues with Rachael Newman, the only victim who managed to escape Bateman’s grasp. Rachael will get rid of anyone who threatens her chances of becoming teaching assistant to the infamous Dr. Daniels.
American Psycho II: All American Girl

4837: Carlos, a fiesty boy fueled by seeing pictures of his dead father, takes off to Almeria, Spain to seek out his flaky grandfather, who used to be Clint Eastwood’s stand-in.

89198: A collage of foliage, trees and sun: green, grey, red and golden yellow, weaving, spinning and bursting outwards from within the density of Barn Owl’s twin guitar fusion.

112926: Meaza Ashenafi is a young lawyer who operates under the government’s radar helping women and children until one young girl’s legal case exposes everything, threatening not only her career but her survival.

17278: Giant spiders from another dimension invade Wisconsin.

28729: Los Angeles is depicted in 35 stationary shots, each two and a half minutes long, in this non-narrative film.

115697: When Europe skips class to climb aboard an eight wheel truck with a magnetic young man named Jupiter, little does she know of the journey of initiation that lies ahead of her. Just off the side of the motorway lies a land inhabited by powerful gods…

3786: Ruan Ling-yu (Maggie Cheung) is riding high in her acting career when the press decides to take her down a notch or two, bitterly criticizing her for an affair with a married man.

29573: A womanizer meets his match when he falls for a woman in debt to the mafia.

16022: In this adaptation of Alberto Casella’s stage play, Death assumes human form in order to discover why men fear him. Posing as a Prince Sirki (and played by Fredric March), Death appears as a house guest at the villa of an Italian duke.

28485: Manoel is an aging film director who travels with his film crew through Portugal in search of the origins of Afonso, a famous French actor whose father emigrated from Portugal to France, and in process remembers his own youth.
Voyage to the Beginning of the World

2670: Immanuel Rath, an old bachelor, is a professor at the town’s university. When he discovers that some of his pupils often go into a speakeasy, The Blue Angel, to visit a dancer named Lola Lola, he comes there to confront them, but meets Lola herself…

1807: Director Davis Guggenheim eloquently weaves the science of global warming with Al Gore’s personal history and lifelong commitment to reversing the effects of global climate change in one of the most talked-about documentary’s of all time.

3856: Snow’s films focus on the mechanics of the camera and the formalistic possibilities of filmmaking. Like 2002’s Waking Life, *Corpus Callosum was shot on video with real-life actors and animated afterwards with Houdini software.

31250: A young married woman (Molly Parker) sells her body, not just for money, to guests at the motel where she works as a receptionist.

1963: Lovers is a love story which focuses on the difficulties of opening up to another person. Dragan (Sergej Trifunovic), a young painter from the former Yugoslavia, walks into a bookshop, and Jeanne, the woman behind the counter (Elodie Bouchez), decides to fall in love with him.

96412: Peluca follows its main character, Seth, as he skips school with two of his friends to buy a fanny pack and a wig…

33365: An experimental video variation on Shakespeare’s Hamlet, an interesting experiment mixing the unique Carmelo Bene’s vocal technique with experimental filmaking.

2714: Woody Allen and Diane Keaton play a middle-aged couple in Manhattan who become a pair of amateur sleuths when they begin to suspect that their neighbor has murdered his wife.

379: The land is prey to unrest, gangs wander the streets of the capital, a catastrophe of terrifying proportions is imminent. Valuskha, a sometime postal worker and visionary, advocates a dogged utopia.

116654: A couple targets the Mafia for heists and stumbles upon something big at an underground club.

111599: Mike Tyson’s one-man show is a fascinating journey into his storied life and career.

99875: Marco is a travelling salesman and a recovering alcoholic who decides to change the direction of his life after a stay at a detox centre.

21811: 1930, on a sugar cane plantation in Martinique live José, a bright, mischievous 11-year-old, and his grandmother, a tough, wise woman determined to save him from the hard life she has known.

127144: In a family gathering, Mother wants to give five cupboards to her five children as part of her inheritance. However the cupboard that was supposed to be a gift became a burden for Tri, her own third child.

8493: Neil Jordan directs a loose remake of Jean-Pierre Melville’s Bob le flambeur starring Nick Nolte as an American thief in Nice.

22666: A sailor on shore leave becomes fascinated by a woman who poses as a mermaid in an oceanfront carnival. As their relationship blossoms, Johnny realizes that Mora is more than a sideshow illusionist.

118869: New England in the 1630s: William and Katherine lead a devout Christian life with five children, homesteading on the edge of an impassable wilderness. When their newborn son vanishes and crops fail, the family turns on one another.

20637: In 1959, four major jazz albums were made, each a high water mark for the artists and a powerful reflection of the times. Rarely seen archive performances help vibrantly bring the era to life and explore what made these albums vital both in 1959 and the 50 years since.

99409: The Creation As We Saw It

23840: Based on Chandler’s The Little Sister, Marlowe involves the detective’s efforts to locate the missing brother of Orfamay Quest (Sharon Farrell).

39186: The film concerns a private detective agency and the problems it has staying in business and out of trouble. It is also a social comedy and a very penetrating comment on the human condition.

41258: The story of Tess Durbeyfield, a low-born country girl whose family find they have noble connections.

23558: A feature-length documentary delving into the personal and public lives of heavy metal icon and Motörhead frontman Lemmy Kilmister.

21975: Romance blooms between two soldiers stationed in an Israeli outpost on the Lebanese border.

87075: Flavia is a thirtysomething married teacher. She has suppressed the memory of her adolescent lesbian fling and is stuck in a stifling marriage. A chance encounter in a supermarket reawakens dormant feelings and she begins to think back on her teenage affair..

21509: Follow two space convicts as they earn their freedom in exchange for the rescue of a young girl who is being held captive by the genetically designed figurehead of a very wealthy planet.

20753: An elegiac portrait of goings-on in the middle-American town of Sydney, Ohio, a celebration of everyday life, be it mundane or profound.

24945: “Bolero” by Ravell is expressed in the mouvements of surrealistic paintings and in the rhythm of the film.

26568: In this comedy of manners, the American Winterbourne tries to figure out the bright and bubbly Daisy Miller, only to be helped and hindered by false judgments from their fellow friends.

27732: For four months, King follows the daily routines of eight patients suffering from dementia and memory loss; the result is searing, compassionate drama that can bring to the viewer a greater understanding of his or her loved ones.
Memory for Max, Claire, Ida and Company

25763: Confounded by her clashes with the seemingly rule-obsessed world, a little girl seeks enlightenment from her unconventional drama teacher.

24539: A wave of unexplainable suicides sweeps across Tokyo after 54 smiling high school girls join hands and throw themselves from a subway platform into an oncoming train. Are the jumpers part of a cult? What is the connection to the website that chronicles suicides…before they happen?

26914: When the head of a statue sacred to a village is stolen, a young martial artist goes to the big city and finds himself taking on the underworld to retrieve it.

27656: “Until you turn 30, you have the face God gave you. After that, you have the face you deserve.” This estranged musical comedy seeks to convince its protagonist, Francisco, that the saying is true.

24821: A couple explores the jungle in search of a spiritual tree while a film crew shoots a musical number.

23790: Everyone has experienced this phenomenon: whenever a glance is cast your way for a certain length of time, you can feel it, and physically.

32010: High school senior Ben secretly lusts after bad boy classmate Johnny. After Ben gives Johnny a ride home one night, the boys end up in Johnny’s swimming pool and have an encounter that breaks the rules and blows Ben’s mind.

3461: A symphony of vivid, sumptuous, dreamy, luxuriant colors symbolically weaving webs around doomed, decadent characters.

11008: Ivan is a priest in a rural church known for the apples that grow on a large tree in front. He’s odd, in denial about personal facts, and convinced he’s at war with Satan. When a recently paroled convict comes to stay at his rectory for rehabilitation, all hell breaks loose.

29694: Features in-depth conversations with 9 of the world’s greatest directors: Bernardo Bertolucci, David Lynch, Liliana Cavani, Stephen Frears, Agnes Varda, Ken Loach, Todd Haynes, Catherine Breillat, Richard Linklater and John Sayles.

256: When a veteran anchorman is forced out of his post, he announces to viewers that he will kill himself during his farewell broadcast. Network executives rethink their decision when his fanatical tirade results in a spike in ratings.

12203: In this comedy, as American astronauts prepare to make one giant leap for mankind, a small Australian town stumbles through its own small steps to help—by using one of the world’s largest radio telescope dishes, nestled in a New South Wales community of sheep farmers.

13059: A bisexual petty criminal named Bob encounters a married couple arguing in a bar. Bob breaks up the fight and proceeds to seduce first the wife and then the husband. Then Bob teaches the couple how to be burglars and they join him in his criminal exploits.

1430: Born in a rural farming village in 1918, Tome grows up to survive decades of Japanese social upheaval, as well as abuse and servitude at the hands of various men. Yet Shohei Imamura refuses to make a victim of Tome, instead observing her as a fascinating, pragmatic creature of 20th century Japan.

332: An antisocial young man, obsessed with death, finds himself drawn to a free-spirited and much, much older woman. With this idiosyncratic and dreamy American fable, director Hal Ashby fashioned what would become a cult classic of its era.

3505: The story of an ordinary man’s search for clarity when his life begins to come apart at the seams. Struggling for equilibrium, he seeks advice from three different rabbis. Can anyone help him cope with his afflictions and become a righteous person, a mensch, a serious man?

1928: Based on the Rwandan genocide that went mostly unnoticed by the rest of the world. The film profiles Paul Rusesabagina, a hotel manager that housed over a thousand Tutsi refugees despite the danger to himself and his family.

32174: A day in the life of a small, Welsh fishing village called “Llareggub” (read it backwards). We meet a host of curious characters (and ghosts) through the ‘eyes’ of Blind Captain cat.

30125: Following the lives of firefighters as they deal with joys and hardships, both on the job and with their own personal lives.

95652: Runyonesque Broadway gamblers turn patriotic when they stumble onto a cell of Nazi saboteurs.

30289: Every dorm has a tale. But this tale, you will never forget.

6535: A southern town is rocked by scandal when teenager Mary Clay is murdered on Confederate Decoration Day. Andrew Griffin, a small-time lawyer with political ambitions, sees the crime as his ticket to the Senate if he can find the right victim to finger for the crime.

48157: On a sinking ship, Luke and four friends face a terrifying choice: stay on board with slim hope of rescue, or swim twelve miles to the nearest island through shark-infested waters. When they enter the water, an unstoppable, relentless great white shark immediately follows their trail.

28606: A teacher who is having an affair with one of his students takes her out on a boat. They see a knife killing on shore. Other gruesome murders start occurring shortly thereafter, and the teacher suspects that he may be the cause of them.
What Have You Done to Solange?

91438: As young children, half-siblings Axel and Yanne are adopted and separated—he goes to live on Oslo’s wealthy West side, and she is sent to an average family on the East side. They meet again when Yanne’s friend Maria goes to work as a maid for Axel’s family.

37020: Bumbling Ernest P. Worrell is assigned to jury duty, where a crooked lawyer notices a resemblance with crime boss Mr. Nash, and arranges a switch.

114486: Little Hero, his brother and his brother’s faithful friend Khaled, all live a joyous life together, but they remain poor despite their best efforts. They work continuously for days on end for the sole purpose to give Little Hero a fruitful life…

28762: Since the earliest days in her childhood Lara has had a difficult but important task. Both her parents are deaf-mute and Lara has to translate from sign-language to the spoken word and vice versa when her parents want to communicate with other people.

2597: Jeff is a rodeo rider broken by one-too many steers and over-reaching for the American Dream. He falls in with a young rancher who has the two things Jeff could never grasp: a clod of earth and the love of a good wife. Yet the rodeo circuit’s fast money are also luring the couple.

31989: A small-town girl ventures to Los Angeles and finds her place in a neo-burlesque club run by a former dancer.

28320: After the world is decimated by a man-made plague, a battle of literally Biblical proportions ensues between the survivors.

34669: Time passes quietly for João de Deus, the eccentric alter ego of celebrated filmmaker João César Monteiro, as he returns home, observes a beautiful woman, and lingers his gaze over the city. Part of a triade of short films about the misadventures of good old João de Deus.

4042: It is the summer of 1941. An eastern-Finnish machine gun company receives an order to turn in their surplus equipment. The company is transferred to the front lines. The next morning the soldiers wake to the sound of guns – the war has begun.

35433: Two deranged friends bring along another guy to go on a random murder rampage.

37462: Three reporters and an office girl are trying to stop a bacteriological strike by some powerful western business leaders against the USSR.

6013: Billy Wilder creates a searing portrait of an alcoholic. Don Birnam is a writer whose lust for booze consumes his career, his life, and his loved ones.

36638: Bernward Vesper, son of Nazi writer Will Vesper, meets his great love in the early 1960s: Gudrun Ensslin.

15620: A decaying mansion and a stormy night provide perfect setting for mystery and chaos when a pack of greedy relatives gather for the reading of a twenty-year-old will…

14962: Two very different policemen seeking the truth about separate crimes find a terrible common link in this thriller from France.

35557: A video biography of Frank Mouris that assembles magazine images with a dual sound track.

4126: A romantic drama about a soldier who falls for a conservative college student while he’s home on leave.

28244: The Stray Cay Rock series opens up where we are introduced a tomboy biker who is being laughed at by a male biker gang known as ‘The Black Shirt Corps”. Soon there after she meets the leader of a girl gang named May (Meiko Kaji) and the two quickly become friends.
Stray Cat Rock: Delinquent Girl Boss

77044: Friends-turned-foes Junbao and Tianbao battle over power and redemption in this martial arts drama.

31491: This experimental film is a fantastic kaleidoscope of 60’s art happenings and chance juxtapositions, a stunning masterpiece of British avant-garde film.

108895: A series of characters die in ridiculous and gory ways. They take it in good spirits however and their corpses dance merrily together.

37506: This was filmed on November 5, 1966 in New York City. It is with Srila Prabhupada, Barbara Rubin, Phil Corner, and many others.

11952: An old, sickly British barrister, urged to retire by his live-in nurse and his doctors, finds a new murder case hard to resist and decides to step into the courtroom again to defend a man accused of killing a wealthy widow for her money.

30567: Kaisa (Lena Headey), a beautiful and feisty Scottish woman, finally has her life together… at least until her mother (Charlotte Rampling) asks an enormous favor: to bring back to her Kaisa’s estranged larger-than-life father (Stellan Skarsgård).

32536: After causing restaurant chaos at work, a bumbling waiter tears up the local roller rink with his skating.

3147: On a cruise, uptight British couple Nigel and Fiona encounter an alluring French woman named Mimi and her wheelchair-bound husband Oscar. As Oscar tells the torrid story of how he and Mimi fell in love, Nigel finds himself increasingly drawn to her, with potentially devastating results…

30403: Four friends take off on an 1800 mile road trip to retrieve an illicit tape mistakenly mailed to a girl friend.

49587: Part of the United Nations’ elite covert action unit, Shaw is trained in the art of victory without combat. But when Shaw is framed for an ambassador’s murder, he’ll do whatever it takes to clear his name.

31659: In a small town, a wrongfully killed man exacts revenge on those who murdered him beyond the grave.

614: By turns charming and inventive, René Clair’s lyrical masterpiece about the journey of a winning lottery ticket had a profound impact on not only the Marx Brothers and Charlie Chaplin, but on the American musical as a whole.

16787: When household tensions and a sense of worthlessness overcome Evan, he finds escape when he clings with the orphans of a throw-away society.

3023: Thirty years ago, aliens arrived on Earth to seek asylum from their dying planet, only to be separated from humans in the makeshift tent city District 9. A field agent knows exactly where to hide when a mysterious virus begins to alter his DNA.

32452: China Valdes joins the Cuban underground after her brother is killed by the chief of the secret police, Ariete. She meets and falls in love with American expatriate Tony Fenner. Tony develops a plan to blow up the whole Cuban hierarchy at a state funeral.

47545: A ‘phantom ride’ taken from the buffers of an engine on the London and South West Railway through the Ilfracombe area, Devon.
View from an Engine Front - Ilfracombe

45968: The story of the “Titanic”, a liner which struck an iceberg on her maiden voyage and sank with a loss of 1,517 lives.

105894: A short experimental animation by Keiichi Tanaami.

21383: A cannabis user and his dealer are forced to go on the run after they witness a policeman commit a murder.

43483: In the labyrinthine streets of 21st century Paris, where every move is monitored and ever action recorded, a mysterious kidnapping sets into motion a catastrophic series of events that could ultimately prove the downfall of civilization.

47939: Two brothers (Kim Bodnia, Dejan Cukić), one cold and ruthless, the other sensitive and reluctant, and their brutal misadventures.

103903: Artie and Diane agree to look after their three grandkids when their type-A helicopter parents need to leave town for work. Problems arise when the kids’ 21st-century behavior collides with Artie and Diane’s old-school methods.

27214: Catherine, refuses to believe that her business partner, the unlikeable François, has a best friend, so she challenges him to set up an introduction. Scrambling to find someone willing to pose as his best pal, François enlists the services of a charming taxi driver to play the part.

60983: U.S. Navy pilot Frank ‘Spig’ Wead is a fun-loving and rowdy adventurer, but also a fierce proponent of Naval aviation. His dedication to the promotion of the Navy’s flying program is so intense that his marriage and family life suffer.

47421: A mocumentary look at the annual Penguin World Surfing Championship, and its newest participant, up-and-comer Cody Maverick.

25321: A disturbed priest, who witness an occult ritual, thinks the people are possessed and start a private inquisition to exorcise the demons by torturing them to death.

119369: Rahmat and Tata have been married for 7 years, unfortunately they haven’t been blessed yet to have a baby. In the middle of this heating problem, Rahmat’s ex-girlfriend who had just been divorced, Shinta, came back to Rahmat’s life.

85502: It’s feast or famine when Arab ambassador Ahmed Ibn Fahdlan is sent to make peaceful contact with the barbaric Vikings in A.D. 922. Soon, he finds himself in the midst of a battle between the Norsemen and their supernatural, flesh-eating enemies.

40524: Gary (Martin Freeman), a once successful musician, struggles with his career and an inert relationship with his girlfriend Dora (Gwyneth Paltrow).

11919: With a boss from hell, a dead end job, an overbearing, ill mother and no friends, life has become one big trap for Willard Stiles. Things start looking up when he is sent to dispose of rats that were found in his home and instead discovers that he begins to share a powerful bond with them.

32901: A ragtag community of newly arrived Chileans escaping Pinochet’s military regime face problems in Paris, so they kidnap and attempt to re-educate a touring singer from their homeland. This improvised, satirical semi-documentary effectively led to Ruiz’s rejection by his fellow exiles.

31776: Andrei lives a secluded life with his aunt, studying and thinking about his now-deceased mother. His friend Tsenin is concerned, and tries to get Andrei to accompany him to social events…

92196: A loving husband, a mother-in-law who cares, an attractive house, a puppy and the project to have a child. Lena has everything to be happy. But at the end of one year, Lena is still not pregnant and takes refuge in the training of her dog.

2356: Young New York cop Dan falls in love with waterfront waitress Helen. Helen’s sister Kate falls for gangster Duke. Dan must do in Duke.

13948: A rather neurotic ant tries to break from his totalitarian society while trying to win the affection of the princess he loves.

149016: A film in three parts: An aquarium, a man sitting at a table reading various text passages, and a sequence from Jean Renoir’s film La Marseillaise.

13450: The death of Vincent, the director of one of the prestigious jewelry shop on chic Place Vendôme, leaves his wife, Marianne, at a terrible crossroads in her life.

1039: An unemployed man finds his life sinking more and more into trouble as he hides his situation from his family and friends.

37785: A bourgeois couple, modern yet conventional. One night by accident, a young prostitute barges into their lives. Hounded down, beaten up, threatened, she will continue to struggle, with the help of a well off lady, first for her survival-her resurrection-then for her dignity and freedom.

149172: Just out of college, a young idealist filmmaker joined a secretive spiritualist community led by a charismatic guru. With camera in hand, this person documented 20 years of living inside a cult and the changing worldviews it elicited.

32419: Brigitte Bardot stars as Agnes Dumont, a schoolgirl sent to live in a convent by her father for writing a racy novel. Instead, she escapes to Paris where she lives on the wild side and, under a pseudonym, becomes a popular striptease act.

3068: In a marksmanship contest, Lin McAdam wins a prized Winchester rifle, which is immediately stolen by the runner-up, Dutch Henry Brown.

30834: A husband and wife lock their diaries in a drawer and also know that they read each other’s entries, a device which takes them from one sexual encounter to another.

2232: Cashier Maurice Legrand is married to Adele, a terror. By chance, he meets Lucienne, “Lulu”, and make her his mistress.

29131: A contemporary comedic look at black college life. Dap (Fishburne) and Big Brother Almighty (Esposito) conflict over the greek frat system while the Wanna-be’s and Jigaboo’s conflict over self-identity and self-esteem.

74360: When her longtime dance partner Carmelo mysteriously disappears, 40-something Julia sets out to find him on a journey that promises to spice up her boring life forever.

4009: Various MGM stars from yesterday present their favourite musical moments from the studio’s 50 year history.

96298: Tells the tale of Alex as he moves into a peculiar house that mysteriously drips blood on him — a situation that he finds puzzling, perplexing and disturbing.
The House That Drips Blood On Alex

34622: Cops investigate a criminal running an unsuspecting restaurant, while trying to trace the steps back to how he ended up running it suddenly.

33993: Jigsaw locks a few unlucky people in a booby trapped shelter and they must find a way out before they inhale too much of a lethal nerve gas and die.

133151: Recounts the final days of Roland, beloved father of a tight-knit family.

95093: President Lincoln’s mother is killed by a supernatural creature, which fuels his passion to crush vampires and their slave-owning helpers.

36673: Loosely based on the 1964 Peter Sellers original film, where the detective must solve the murder of a famous soccer coach and find out who stole the infamous Pink Panther diamond.

35804: Fischinger’s three-and-a-half-week long trip on foot from Munich to Berlin captured on a 35mm camera in 1927.

56046: Rookie cop Marc and his veteran partner, Minks, are assigned to a case involving a serial killer whose intense feelings for tattoo art propel him to prey on the unsuspecting tattooed public of Berlin.

29055: The young couple have decided to marry and it is time to ask the father for the hand of his daughter. Problem is, the father does not want to give the daughter away.

111277: Iffet lives in a low income neighbourhood of Istanbul with her sister and father under the strict rules of her father. She can not even go visit her aunt since she is not allowed to leave home without permission. She nevethless falls in love with Cemil…

16978: Who killed Mr. Boddy? Was it Colonel Mustard in the study with the gun? Miss Scarlet in the billiard room with the rope? Or was it Wadsworth the butler?

30680: The Kingdom: Part 3 - A Foreign Body

93060: A man who lives in his car gets caught up in the undeclared war between motorcycle riders and car drivers.

87800: As part of an intergalactic coalition, a well-meaning space alien volunteers to bring a message of self-actualization and harmony with nature to the one planet rejected by all her peers as incorrigible Earth.

40877: The proceedings of a Paris courtroom are the grist for this documentary. Drawn from over 200 appearances before the same female judge, the director chooses a dozen or so varied misdemeanor and civil hearings to highlight the subtle details of human behavior.

27097: The true story of the football team that proved sometimes second chances can make a difference comes to the screen in director Phil Joanou’s tale of self-respect and social responsibility on the gridiron.

23151: Naomi Kawase’s documentary about Nishii Kazuo, a photo critic. He is the last chief editor for the Camera Mainichi magazine, rushing through his time with Araki Nobuyoshi and Moriyama Daido as provocative artists in the photograph world.
Letter from a Yellow Cherry Blossom

40913: An old bitter miser who makes excuses for his uncaring nature learns real compassion when three ghosts visit him on Christmas Eve.

99000: Jim Gaffigan does it again with his new stand-up Mr. Universe. Gaffigan jumps from topic to topic joking around with a varied number of topics. Some of the topics included are McDonalds, family, Disney World, and much more.

43764: This is the true story of Joe Valachi who in 1963, before a United States Investigating Committee and a vast live television audience, explained for the first time the inner workings of The Mafia; speaking from experience, having been a valued member of Cosa Nostra for thirty-three years.

46884: A 1908 British short silent documentary film featuring a woman displaying assorted tartan cloths, shot as a showcase the new Kinemacolor system.

19928: Several satellites have been destroyed without explanation. A few days later, a group of diamond thieves are thwarted when the gems they are after suddenly disappear. Strangely enough, the two incidents are connected when scientists discover that a giant jellyfish like creature.

24054: Somehow the all-encompassing benefits of the socialist “paradise” of Czechoslovakia bypassed the group of old farmers shown in this 1972 documentary almost entirely, and they are shown bravely coping with dire poverty and privation.

23399: Absent-minded inventor Shurik has built a time machine in his Moscow apartment. Due to the machine’s malfunctioning, his apartment complex manager Ivan Vasilievich and a suave burglar are transposed back to the times of Ivan the Terrible, while the dreaded Czar himself turns up in modern-day Moscow.

46754: Monkeys and apes swing through the trees to the usual mix of classical tunes and standards; including this time the recent vaudeville hit “Abba Dabba Dabba.”

41499: A police officer is murdered with a bayonet while staying in hospital. The investigative team, lead by Martin Beck, soon discover that the man had frequently abused suspects as well as civilians but that any complaints had been ignored owing to the misguided loyalty of his colleagues.

20192: Ming warriors fight against Chinese-Japanese pirates. The strategist Yu has to bring the complex conflict to an end.

44705: Thirteen year-old Marta has recently moved back to southern Italy with her mother and older sister and struggles to find her place, restlessly testing the boundaries of an unfamiliar city and the catechism of the Catholic church.

26005: When perennial college students Danny O’Neill and Hank Taylor are forced to make it on their own, the competitive pair get jobs with Artie Shaw’s band and reunite with ex-manager Ellen Miller.

45847: CIA analyst Jack Ryan must thwart the plans of a terrorist faction that threatens to induce a catastrophic conflict between the United States and Russia’s newly elected president by detonating a nuclear weapon at a football game in Baltimore.

24130: Young blonde translator Rebecca lives with her boyfriend ski instructor Marco in a mountain villa owned by her friend, nurse Laura. Rene, local cinema projectionist, steals Marco’s car and gets into a car crash with local Theo, whose daughter, after being in coma for a time, dies.

44661: A rich girl whose family summers on Cape Cod has a romance with a local poor boy who hopes to become a major league baseball player.

38805: After being abandoned by her husband, and facing several problemas as losing the custody of her two children to him, Julia will attempt to take revenge.

26161: A woman walks a fine line between sanity and madness in a world of constant twilight in this impressionistic experimental drama from filmmakers Maartje Seyferth and Victor Nieuwenhuijs.

22987: Several Jewish and Palestinian children are followed for three years and put in touch with each other, in this alternative look at the Jewish-Palestinian conflict. The three filmmakers followed a group of seven local children between 1995 and 1998.

26841: Two young children living illegally in a model apartment outside Boston are left to fend for themselves when their hardworking mother disappears.

18252: A mentally unstable Vietnam war vet, when abused with a small town’s police force, begins a one man war with it.

45003: In an imaginary dictature of a futuristic world, rebellion has broken out. The men in power scramble to the Bunker Palace Hotel, a bunker built long ago for just this kind of contingency…

46208: A Japanese professor has made a perfect copy of himself as a robot. He is obsessed with finding out if he can implement human presence in a robot.

24508: A strait-laced French student (Romain Duris) moves into an apartment in Barcelona with six other wanderers, students, and misfits from all over Europe. Together, they speak an international language of love and friendship.

26925: A love triangle develops between three people who run a high-tech chicken farm. It involves Anna (who owns the farm), her husband Marco (who seemingly kills prostitutes in his spare time) and Gabriella (the beautiful secretary).

25752: In 1963, director Michael Apted and then-partner Paul Almond chronicled the lives of 14 seven-year-olds for British television; they returned to the same group at intervals of seven years for updates, of which this is the fifth.

103068: Almost 30 years after the Brazilian dictatorship, Michael Wahrmann is afraid this period and its victims will be forgotten. This inspired him to make his first feature, in which he incorporates his own experiences as a young left-wing militant in Israel.

21944: A-yuan and A-yun are both from the small mining town of Jio-fen. In the city, A-yuan is an apprentice by day and goes to night school, and A-yun works as a helper at a tailors. Everyone thinks they are meant for each other, so do they. They fail to see time and fate are beyond their control.

22733: A movie director does a new film against heroine consumption, and the producers are heroine dealers.

118540: Seemingly unconnected citizens of Tokyo are targeted for bludgeoning by a boy with a golden baseball bat. As detectives try to link the victims, they discover that following the assaults, the victims’ lives have improved in some way.

25882: Paolo is a divorced father of two who earns his living as a nightclub entertainer. One night, he meets Francesca, a strangely attractive woman, and after some rather peculiar talk about her having had sex with an Indian guru, they head off for his beach house for an assignation.

98706: A day trip to Suffolk, to see my friend Ben and his dad Oleg…

21538: On October 26, 1979, President Park Chung-hee, who had ruled South Korea since 1961, was assassinated by his director of intelligence. The film depicts the events of that night…

118424: A martial arts instructor from the police force gets imprisoned after killing a man by accident. But when a vicious killer starts targeting martial arts masters, the instructor offers to help the police in return for his freedom.

22657: A young girl is caught up in the 1980 Gwangju massacre, where Korean soldiers killed hundreds, if not thousands, of protesters who opposed the country’s takeover by the military the year before.

21820: Beautiful violin virtuoso Camille has two obsessions: the music of Ravel, and a friend of her husband’s who crafts violins. But his heart seems to be as cold as her playing is passionate.

99844: Irene is a secluded old woman who lives in a house in the countryside. When her granddaughter shows for an unexpected visit, along with a new friend, Irene’s isolation is disturbed and she starts to unveil feelings she thought were forgotten.

118858: Minnie Goetze is a 15-year-old aspiring comic-book artist, coming of age in the haze of the 1970s in San Francisco. Insatiably curious about the world around her, Minnie is a pretty typical teenage girl. Oh, except that she’s sleeping with her mother’s boyfriend.
The Diary of a Teenage Girl

37011: Middle-aged businessman, Simon Léotard finds his future in jeopardy when his partner Julien commits suicide after having accumulated a mass of debts. Simon’s unscrupulous business rival Lépidon offers to save him from bankruptcy by buying his company, at a discount rate.

31186: After serving three years in prison for a bank robbery he did not commit, an amiable but aimless man decides to rob the bank for real. His plan involves infiltrating a local theatre company, but his scheme gets complicated when he falls for the company’s lead actress.

53686: Scott Thomas is reluctant when his longtime cyber-buddy from Berlin, Mieke, suggests they meet face-to-face. But when he discovers his pen pal is a gorgeous young woman, Scott embarks with his friends on a trip across Europe.

28753: Gregory invites seven friends to spend the summer at his large, secluded 19th-century home in upstate New York.

68211: Still sporting the Number 53, the feisty Herbie is now owned by Maggie Peyton, a speed-demon who meets with adventure — both on the road and off — with the free-wheeling Volkswagen bug as they prepare to compete in the world-famous NASCAR races.

29509: A much-needed boost in the form of a new factory, is promised to the residents of a tiny fishing village, provided they can lure a doctor to take up full-time residency on the island. Inspired, the villagers devise a scheme to make Dr. Lewis a local.

4929: Gripping psychological thriller with Sigourney Weaver, Ben Kingsley and Stuart Wilson by film veteran Roman Polanski.

132657: A bridegroom is possessed by an unquiet spirit in the midst of his own wedding celebration.

3698: Irrestisible charm and talent helps Serge Alexandre alias Stavisky, small-time swindler, to make friends with even most influential members of French industrial and political elite during the early 30s.

93824: An hour-long discussion between Fritz Lang and Jean-Luc Godard in which they discuss a variety of art forms, the role of the cinema, their collaboration together, and much more. Made back in 1964 but edited and released for TV in 1967.

17366: Gino, a drifter, begins an affair with inn-owner Giovanna as they plan to get rid of her older husband.

110869: The video begins with an aerial shot of a block in Los Angeles, and clips of radio broadcasts are heard with disc jockeys stating that U2 is planning on performing a concert downtown and expecting crowds of 30,000 people.
