25308: A 1993 horror  musical short film/long form music video filmed and directed by Peter Christopherson, based on a scenario by Trent Reznor, the founder of the industrial rock band Nine Inch Nails.

107988: When the circus arrives they put the lion’s cage right over Bugs’ rabbit hole.

24152: In post-Civil War Georgia, seven-year old Johnny is on his grandmother’s plantation when he discovers Uncle Remus, a wise, elderly black man who regales Johnny with magical tales of Br’er Rabbit, Br’er Fox, and Br’er Bear. Through Uncle Remus’ adventurous stories, Johnny learns life lessons.

102668: Marco, a Serbian soldier on leave during the war, returns to his Bosnian hometown. When three fellow soldiers accost Haris, a Muslim shopkeeper, Marco intervenes, but it costs him his life. Twelve years later the war is over, but the wounds remain open.

22369: Judge Foster throws his daughter out because she married a circus man. She leaves her baby girl with Prof. McGargle before she dies. Years later Sally is a dancer with whom Peyton, a son of Judge Foster’s friend, falls in love. When Sally is arrested McGargle proves her real parentage.

41633: A television reporter and her cameraman find themselves in the middle of intertwined professional and personal dilemma.

20338: A goalkeeper is sent off during a game for committing a foul. Lost and lonely, he spends the night with a cinema cashier, only things don’t go as planned…
The Goalie’s Anxiety at the Penalty Kick

23057: This lavish Hungarian film chronicles the exploits of a Magyar Casanova in the early years of the 20th century.

104537: Melissa Winters works as a cashier in a convenience store. It’s a dead end job, one dollar above minimum wage, but it’s as good as she can get. Her boyfriend, Richie Barnes is permanently disabled. Will their relationship survive, despite all the difficult circumstances?

39489: A family of fiercely independent Oregon loggers struggle to keep the family business alive amidst changing times.

40971: In Italy, a dying woman tells her granddaughter that she hid her treasure many years ago in Russia, in the city of Leningrad. Other people (who were around when she died) also learn about it. Thus several people arrive in Leningrad trying to find the treasure, each one for himself/herself.
Unbelievable Adventures of Italians in Russia

84771: When Junior moves to Mortville with his newly single dad, he struggles with the the possibility of having a new mother. Junior promptly sabotages all of his father’s romantic propects… and learns he isn’t the only kid capable of wreaking havoc!

27191: The film tells the story of a man who comes to Hollywood to become a star, only to fail and be dehumanized. He is identified by the number 9413 written on his forehead, after which he dies and goes to Heaven, where the number is removed.
The Life and Death of 9413, a Hollywood Extra

36611: A 30 year old mystery resurfaces and takes over the lives of the people living in an eerie apartment complex.

54111: Sinbad is Kevin Franklin, a get-rich-quick con man who escapes the mob by impersonating the long-lost friend of an uptight businessman and moving in with his family. Soon this wily “houseguest” is struggling to find out who he’s pretending to be… a wine expert, a golfer, or even a dentist!

30786: Linda gets raped by a man in a hockey mask. She finds that a few other women have had the same treatment…

37837: The protagonist is one of the growing group of poor North Korean refugees who are trying to adapt in capitalist South Korea. The maker, former assistant director to Lee Chang-dong, has made a deeply moving and profound film about the position of the unwanted guest.

16402: A small group of astronauts come wake up to find that their ship has crash-landed on a planet where humans are prelingual and uncivilized and apes have the supreme qualities of speech and use technology.

591: A character study of a career criminal at the end of his rope, this rugged noir from Claude Sautet  is a thrilling highlight of sixties French cinema, starring Lino Ventura and Jean-Paul Belmondo,

48824: After teenage ambulance driver Ernest Hemingway takes shrapnel in the leg during World War I, he falls in love with Agnes von Kurowsky, a beautiful older nurse at the hospital where he’s sent to recover.

1293: Near the Bosporus, Eyüp and and his wife live in a modest flat. Eyüp’s boss, a wealthy businessman, hits a pedestrian on a lonely road. He drives off and offers money to Eyüp if Eyüp will take the fall.

111215: Emmy Award winning, 11-episodes, 5-years in the making, the most expensive nature documentary series ever commissioned by the BBC, and the first to be filmed in high definition.

2098: In this highly controversial psychodrama, a heartbroken couple grieving the loss of their child attempts to find peace and sanity in the relationship through a trip to their cabin in the woods. But nature reveals its dark roots as things begin to spiral downwards.

5355: A Japanese collector goes to Australia to buy the car of his dreams and embarks on a strange, erotic journey.

131006: Haim-Aaron is an ultra-Orthodox religious scholar from Jerusalem whose talent and devotion are envied by all. One evening, following a self-imposed fast, he collapses and loses consciousness.

113244: Charles is the owner of a photo-shop. He is not too friendly and spends his evenings alone, and one day he finally decides to get a social life. He meets elderly Florence, who is tormented by her gambling husband Lester and longs for the son Willie she hasn’t seen or heard of for 20 years.

37953: Times are troubled – there’s a revolt of peasants going on. To secure its safety, a monastery chases for the relics of a holy Brigitte. A nobleman promises to get it if he gets beautiful Agnes as a reward, but she falls in love with a handsome adventurer.

17490: As the Clone Wars continue, Obi-Wan is sent to eliminate the leader of the Separatist Army. With his mentor away, Anakin Skywalker begins forming a bond with Chancellor Palpatine and begins his descent into the dark side.
Star Wars: Episode III - Revenge of the Sith

2334: A number of provocative, award-winning ads tout the Helvetica font; Gary Hustwit explores the subject with his feature-length essay film Helvetica. The documentary, produced in 2007 (and thus commemorating the typeface’s 50th anniversary) uses the omnipresent font as a lens.

114225: The young woman, Marie, is an outsider in the small coastal community where she has grown up. The townspeople live in fear of her and not least her mother, who is wheelchair bound, suffering from a mysterious illness…

94063: A drama film featuring Çetin Tekindor as a elderly exile, whose 10-year-old grandson still feels the affects of the 1923 population exchange between Greece and Turkey, which forced his grandfather from Cyprus.

32963: A lyrical story about first love, death and disappointment, based on a poem of the same title.

31714: Tanguy is 28 years old and still living with his parents. They think it’s time he moves out. He doesn’t, so they hatch a plan.

11463: As a new star and planet hurtle toward a doomed Earth, a small group of survivalists frantically work to complete the rocket which will take them to their new home.

108608: Kang Jun-Il travels to a village in rural Japan to honour his grandfather’s dying wish by returning a Buddhist scroll to its ancestral home. Amid ancient superstitions, a new relationship forms.

10639: In the city slums, a reformed tramp becomes a police constable—and goes toe to toe with a huge thug who dominates the street.

33621: Wonderful short film by Marie Menken, picturing Andy Warhol in the early sixties, at the peak at his creativity.

110287: After twenty years, an old man, widowed by the recent floods, and his son, who has been living in Japan, see each other again for the first time. Their expectations run high and during this brief reencounter, both try to overcome the distance that has grown between them.

116310: The personalities of two former baseball players clash as they traverse the rural back roads of a post-plague New England teeming with the undead.

94107: Santa Claus must undermine a devil from hell’s plans to overthrow Christmas.

860: John Le Carré’s acclaimed bestselling novel about a Cold War spy on one final, dangerous mission, played by Richard Burton in a career-defining performance, is every bit as precise and ruthless on-screen in this adaptation directed by Martin Ritt.
The Spy Who Came in from the Cold

31451: In 1982, Fela discussed his life and work and performed some of his influential songs for this documentary by Stéphane Tchalgadjieff and Jean-Jacques Flori.

89849: The superb Jean-Pierre Darroussin plays a banking executive driven off the rails in Jean-Marc Moutout’s incisive and angry indictment of the financial world.

2071: A frail waif, abused by her brutish boxer father in London’s seedy Limehouse District, is befriended by a sensitive Chinese immigrant with tragic consequences.

114160: Charlie is 17 years old. She at that age where life is all about hanging out with friends, emotions, convictions, passions. Sarah is the new girl in town. Beautiful, bold, with a history and a strong personality. A star from the get-go. Sarah chooses Charlie.

57297: Set in the Southwest, the fourth installment of the Crow franchise tells the story of ex-con Jimmy Cuervo and his girlfriend, Lily, who are murdered by Luc Crash and his gang of satanic bikers in a ritual for Crash to become an immortal demon.

904: In 1977 France, the Ministry of the Future chooses two “normal,” white, middle-class citizens for a national experiment. They will be monitored and displayed on television for six months in a model apartment outfitted with state-of-the-art products and nonstop surveillance.

134217: Shot in Stromboli and Lipari, the film focuses on the indecipherable mystery of nature.

4082: Ben Kalmen is feeling his age, but you wouldn’t know it from the company he keeps. A former mogul with a chain of car dealerships, until legal troubles knocked him out of business, Ben now keeps a grip on the world through his relationships with women – many women.

578: An asteroid the size of Texas is heading directly toward Earth. There is only one option- to send the world’s best deep core drilling team to nuke the rock from the inside.

33564: An African prince goes to Queens, New York City to find a wife whom he can respect for her intelligence and will.

51264: The story of a ten years old boy who, as most of the children in Yugoslavia of the fifties can hardly imagine his life without the great national leader – marshal Tito.

29216: Wayne Szalinski is your average “nutty scientist”, working on a top secret machine which miniaturizes objects. When it unexpectedly starts working, he’s so amazed he forgets to tell his family to be careful. And when they wander into his lab…

50392: French Stewart takes a turn at the wheel of the Gadgetmobile as Inspector Gadget, the bumbling but fearless crime fighter with accessories galore, in this live-action sequel to the 1999 hit.

32492: The movie shows the origin of the Powerpuff Girls before the cartoon series. It explains why they were born and why they dedicated their lives to fighting crime and the forces of evil.

36928: A Los Angeles businesswoman, known only by her street name of Princess, turns to prostitution to support herself and her young daughter when she’s forced by Detective Tom Walsh and his vice squad to help them arrest a brutal pimp named Ramrod for the murder of a prostitute named Ginger.

34505: Santiago, a 30 year old Argentinean, travels to Uruguay searching for a piece of land inherited from his parents who were tragically killed in an accident a few years earlier.

36554: An ambitious young executive chooses a loveless marriage and an unfulfilling personal life in exchange for a successful Wall Street career.

31699: 9th-graders Kazuo (boy) and Kazumi (girl) take a tumble at a temple in a small seacoast town in Japan. Through supernatural intervention, their minds and bodies are switched, and the result is a touching coming-of-age comedy as they attempt to survive the pressures of junior high school life.
I Are You, You Am Me

93223: 17-year-old Daniela, raised in the bosom of a strict Evangelical family and recently unmasked as a fornicator by her shocked parents, struggles to find her own path to spiritual harmony.

3187: A 1947 short film directed and starring Jacques Tati, playing a French postman adamant to prove he can be just as fast as American postmen at delivering mail.

108785: An island off the coast of Turkey is about to be evacuated due to a possible earthquake — but its inhabitants have been stricken with a mysterious illness, consigning them to an uncertain fate. Reha Erdem’s genre-defying new film transports us to a wonderfully wry, oblique universe.

93347: Mr. Church reunites the Expendables for what should be an easy paycheck, but when one of men is murdered on the job, their quest for revenge puts them deep in enemy territory and up against an unexpected threat.

7041: Horror adapted from a Stephen King novella. A group of people find themselves trapped in a supermarket when a deadly mist envelops the small New England town that they are in.

36430: The Peanuts gang celebrates Halloween while Linus waits for the Great Pumpkin.
It's the Great Pumpkin, Charlie Brown

17805: Franz (Fassbinder), an unemployed showman and hooker, wins a half a million in the lottery. Antique dealer Max (Karlheinz Böhm) introduces him to a group of elegant homosexuals. He falls in love with Eugen (Peter Chatel), the son of an entrepreneur.

64885: A montage music video for a song by The Strokes.

107961: Pandane to tamago hime is the story of a tiny Egg-girl who is forced to serve the evil Boar-like witch Baba Yaga. But after a blob of Dough comes to life, she befriends him and both escape from the witch’s home at a Water mill on a cliff and set off to see the world.
Mr. Dough and the Egg Princess

121699: Beautiful, wild, funny, and lost, Katie Kampenfelt takes a year off before college to find herself, all the while chronicling her adventures in an anonymous blog into which she pours her innermost secrets. Eventually, Katie’s fearless narrative begins to crack, and dark pieces of her past emerge.

102681: When five people are shot dead, a trained military sniper becomes the primary perp. The only chance he has to clear his name rests in the hands of one man: Jack Reacher.

23276: Soviet Union, near the Chinese border, 1923. A stranger has just come in this little country village.

42619: Unfolds the poignant story of three women and their search for justice from the daily plight of sexual harassment in Egypt.

106623: Uptight FBI special agent Sarah Ashburn is paired with testy Boston cop Shannon Mullins in order to take down a ruthless drug lord. The hitch: neither woman has ever had a partner — or a friend for that matter.

105854: When an unseen enemy threatens mankind by taking over their bodies and erasing their memories, Melanie will risk everything to protect the people she cares most about, proving that love can conquer all in a dangerous new world.

38596: The film shows 27 still-existing buildings and interiors by Austrian architect Adolf Loos in order of their construction. Adolf Loos was one of the pioneers of European Modernist architecture. His vehement turn against ornamentation on buildings triggered a controversy in architectural theory.

25129: Buttgereit’s unfliching portrayal of his father.

Uncle Boonmee Who Can Recall His Past Lives

A Pedro Almodóvar brilliant early black comedy.

466: Veronica is driving in northwestern Argentina when her mobile phone distracts her and she runs over something—but drives on. The police confirm that there was no accident, but Veronica begins to have a meltdown, thinking she may have killed someone.  Was it an animal? A child? Or nothing at all?

3251: In New York, a gambler is challenged to take a cold female missionary to Havana, but they fall for each other, and the bet has a hidden motive to finance a crap game.

108453: A mild-mannered family man with a secret taste for S&M finds himself pursued by a gang of ruthless dominatrixes — each with a very special talent — in this hilarious and bizarre take on the sex comedy from Japanese comedy giant Hitoshi Matsumoto.

28152: The story of Calamity Jane, her saloon, and her romance with Wild Bill Hickok.

152663: A family fired by a company owned by LVMH (Group owned by French billionaire, Bernard Arnault) seeks reparation from their previous employer with the help of the movie director.

29308: An extraordinary portrait of madness and inner turmoil, conveyed through mesmeric images of dreamlike intensity.

37610: A young couple argue about having a child in the days after a global plague wipes out most of Earth’s population.

15452: A stranger called Allan goes to the House of Usher. He is the sole friend of Roderick Usher, who lives in the eerie house with his sick wife Madeleine. When she dies, Roderick does not accept her death, and in the dark night, Madeleine returns.
The Fall of the House of Usher

34867: The fate of Cairo is in the hands of a British corporal undercover in Rommel’s headquarters.

35725: Set in 1920’s Vienna, this a tale of a little girl, whose godfather gives her a special doll one Christmas Eve.

4354: Set in the fictional town, Dileep, a student of law along with his faithful servant, Bhanwar, secures accommodation in an old, run-down British-era pub. Here he meets Rananjay Singh “Ransa”, a prince, who despises the ideologies of his father and the aristocracy.

3099: A story of two lovers—Zorg (Jean-Hugues Anglade), a novelist, and Betty (Beatrice Dalle), a sexy, mercurial woman—who fall into an all-consuming relationship, moving from a remote shack to bohemian Paris and back to a dreamy rural town, in this intense story of struggling with love and lust.

34903: Billy “The Kid” and his gang is wanted by the law, and when “Doc” Scurlock and Chavez are captured, Billy has to save them. They escape and set south for Mexico.

92003: The Whole Dam Family and the Dam Dog

110214: Love and death become interlaced with immense consequences, as the foibles and fortunes of the people in Iceland are viewed through their horses’ perspective.

37774: In this Franco-Italian gangster parody, a shop keeper on his way to an Italian holiday suffers a crash which totals his car. The culprit can only compensate his ruined trip by driving an American friends car from Napels to Bordeaux, but as it happens to be filled with such as stolen money.

101594: Arriving in a village plagued by corruption and deceit, Zatôichi vows to avenge his slain master.

41814: On the brink of financial ruin and suicidal Patrick Mariel makes a deal with women a mysterious woman named Lorna who promises him wealth in exchange for his first born child.

43845: A homeless man and his young companion who survive by conning people meet a woman who may need them even more than they need her.

23368: Along a sleepy Hunan riverside, two delinquent boys experience a summer of love and violence in Yang Heng’s visually stunning debut.

41468: An early social commentary on the New York sex trade, this film attempts to sensationalize prostitution, especially forced prostitution. Featuring a number of characters and sub-plots, the film is presented as if it were a documentary.

104608: A man is wrongly jailed for murder while the real killer roams free. The man’s wife and children wander the countryside looking for some kind of redemption.

44690: This tells the story of a strong friendship between a young boy with Morquio’s syndrome and an older boy who is always bullied because of his size. Adapted from the novel, Freak the Mighty, the film explores a building of trust and friendship.

107567: An office clerk as seen during her daily routine – all the little vibrations of her face. And a man, impatiently waiting for her, beyond the windows.

126952: A pack of teenage boys choose the wrong girl to be the victim of their ‘initiation’.
